Title: Gone bald for Blackpool foodbank!

Description:
Hello lovely people,

During these testing and troubling times I think it's more important than ever to look for the positives and what we can do to make a difference. After much deliberation (I have lovely hair!) I have decided to shave my head on 30/3/2020 for charity.

Having spoken to my local food bank they have informed me that donations of essential items are decreasing already, and only expect this to get worse as the pandemic continues and/if more measures are put in place. Over 500 people a month use this service already, with this only likely to increase due to the economic hardships COVID-19 is likely to bring. 

With the supermarkets already practically empty its not hard to imagine the devastating impact this could have.

Any money raised here will be going directly to Harlow Foodbank (Co-ordinated by the Michael Roberts Charitable Trust) to help with running costs, such as logistics and warehousing costs, as well as purchase of essential items (tinned foods, toiletries, fruit juice etc.) which are already at critically low levels.

With everything that is going on at the moment I understand how difficult it may be to donate. As a self-employed DJ, I myself have no work for the foreseeable future, however even a donation of £1 could make a difference. 

Now more than ever its important to look out for people in need.

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

Lash x
Title: SHAVE TO SAVE: FOODBANK FUNDRAISER

Description:
This November, I am running a Marathon in a Month to raise funds for Brandlesholme Foodbank. Many of you may have seen that on Wednesday 21st October parliament voted against extending the Free School Meals (FSM) provision for children during the half-term break. As we are all aware, many families are going through increased financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic. No child should go hungry. 

A message from Brandlesholme Foodbank:

We are pleading with residents, companies and groups. We need as much support as possible and help to raise funds so that we can run and maintain Brandlesholme Foodbank alongside our various forms of support. We aim to keep support withing the community, reducing the strain on the NHS and Bury Council. This support system is in its infancy but we have no choice but to rapidly deploy support. We will face large expenses which we cannot fund ourselves and this is where we are relying on your donations to ensure we can meet demand! This facility of providing food and support packages has been carried out around the UK and internationally, the idea is great and as the beating heart of the community, it is our job to repeat this in Bury, Rammy and Totty. We are a member organisation of the Independent Food Aid Network and work with Fareshare Go by Foodcloud.

Title: Bath Foodbank Christmas Joy

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Colleagues in HKA's Glasgow Office recognised that in the current crisis we were in the very fortunate position of being employed, but also saving money while working from home by not commuting and buying lunches, teas and coffees.  

We don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry.  With that in mind we set up this JustGiving page to enable our colleagues and friends to donate directly to the Glasgow NE Foodbank.  They provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. 

Glasgow NE Foodbank are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Please join us in contributing to support them.

Description:
Aaron (12) and James (8) chose to join in #maxsbigcampout. They joined in a garden sleepout to celebrate Max's 365th night  under canvas. Max is a boy from Devon who camped out in his garden for a year to raise money for charity. 'I wanted to keep sleeping out because I wanted to raise money for CHAT so everyone could have a fair life' said James. 

CHAT run the local foodbank; provide debt counselling; and housing support. At the moment their use is increasing as more people need their help.

James is planning to continue camping out for a month.

Gail aka Mum decided to set herself a challenge too. She plans to run the distance to Guernsey (100 miles) by the time Guernsey hopes to open it's borders. 'Jogging has been helpful over the lockdowns, but they have been sporadic 5km runs, so now I will have to run more regularly and further. I have chosen the distance to Guernsey as that was where we were due to go on holiday last summer.' she said.

Title: Black Country Foodbank 2021

Description:
Hundreds of people in Waterloo will go hungry this Christmas. Over the last year Waterloo Foodbank has seen a 73% increase in use, which means they provided food to over 3,000 people and sadly continue to see that number grow. 

That's why, this Christmas I'm raising money for the Waterloo Foodbank. I'm helping them reach their target of £15,000, to support people this Christmas and throughout the year who need our support. Every penny raised will go directly to the work of the Waterloo Foodbank.

For more information about the work the Foodbank does, please go to oasiswaterloo.org/foodbank
Title: Waterloo Foodbank Christmas Appeal

Description:
Everyone has been affected in a way during this pandemic, some more than others. To rebuild and help those most in need we need community, compassion, and generosity. No one should have to go hungry especially the youngest in our society who have faced huge adversity throughout the last 12 months.


In the first six months of the pandemic, the food banks in our network gave out a staggering 1.2 million food parcels. That's one food parcel every 13 seconds, and 2,600 food parcels were given to children every day on average. The impact on young people has been devastating. Together we can build a fairer, more just society, where all of us can afford the essentials. The pandemic has shown the unexpected can hit us suddenly, with devastating consequences for people's lives. But it's also shown we can make huge changes to the way we live and look after each other. It has shown that when we come together we can push for change. Together, we can build a hunger-free future.

By donating a small amount it can make an enormous change in people's lives.

So as a branch, we’re making a donation to the Cambridge City Foodbank, and we're encouraging members who can afford it to do the same. In the fifth-largest economy in the world, foodbanks shouldn't even exist, but after a decade of austerity - and at times of crisis like this - they're more important than ever. Title: LHP Christmas Foodbank Collection

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with

Title: Smartodds' (Post) Christmas Foodbank Donation

Description:
On March 5th next year, 3 aging men are going to cycle 100 miles. We’re going to raise money for the surprisingly large number of foodbanks across the Sussex coast. 

One of these men helps to run a local food bank and the need for food support in the community is now huge. In the 50 mile stretch between Chichester and Seaford there are 30 food banks. 

These foodbanks need support. Three portly men on bikes is not the ideal mechanism for this but its where are.

We are cycling 100 miles. From Worthing to  Chichester to Seaford to Worthing. The 3 of us are going to attempt to raise £30,000 for the 30 food banks along the route. 

We will be stopping at many of these foodbanks along the way, to highlight the shocking scale of need.

So please give generously if you can. Whatever you can given will make all the difference to the foodbanks and the wonderful work they do.

I have pledged to match the amount raised for me so at least a good cause can be well supported.

Phil

Title: Keeley's Hiscox Colchester supports Colchester Foodbank

Title: Auchmuty High School's Glenrothes Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
Even though our office in Lytham is closed, our hearts and wallets aren’t.

A number of colleagues have asked if we can continue our fundraising efforts during lockdown, so we’ve set this page up for you to add your  lockdown charity donations.

Don’t forget the money we raise will be going towards Fylde Foodbank not our normal charities as we felt this was the most worthy cause during this difficult time, providing food and non-food items to support the people of the Fylde Coast when they most need it.

We haven’t forgotten our other charities, we will pick up collections for them when everyone is safely back in the office.

Please give what you can, who knows when any one of us or someone we know may need the foodbank and if we don’t support it now, it may not be there when someone really does need it in the future.

Thanks you everyone for taking the time to visit this Just Giving page.
Title: Atos Protection - Fylde Foodbank Collection

Description:
I figured that with many of us ordering groceries online now, fewer food donations will be collected at the supermarkets to support foodbanks. 

Christmas will be different for most of us this year. My local foodbank provide over 400 Christmas hampers that go to local households. These hampers will bring a little cheer to someone in crises this Christmas. 

For the next 24 days I will be collecting as many food donations from neighbouring estates, friends and family as possible and I will deliver them to my local foodbank and offer help with packing the hampers. 

If you are able to support my effort by making a monetory donation to the Samaritans who are the main beneficiary of the #TeamPurpleYour24 event I will be hugely grateful. 

Sincere thanks and I hope you and your family have a wonderful Christmas.

Gaby 

#TeamPurpleYOUR24 - IFS Christmas Appeal to support one of our amazing customers, the Samaritans! Coronavirus is changing our lives and the Samaritan’s services are under extra strain. The donations you can help raise will help us reach those who are struggling to cope.

Description:
The Universal Church of the Kingdom of God (UCKG) is a Christian Ministry and registered charity (1043985) dedicated to helping people live life to the fullest — physically, emotionally and spiritually.Over the years, we have reached such a diverse group of people that our work has touched millions across over 170 countries. Their unique stories remind us that with the right kind of help and support, the most heartbreaking stories can become tomorrow’s inspirational ones. In these testing times, we are determined to do more. Support us

We are living hards time and many people are being affected by the pandemic and personal circumstances vary, the UCKG is making a great impact in helping thousands of people that are facing challenging hardships.  Please if you could support us out of your good heart by  donating, your support will reach thousands. 

Many thanks

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!

Description:
This Spring, the Re:Member team are inviting all CGI Glasgow members to support the Trussell Trust's Glasgow South West foodbank, to help them continue the amazing work they do in our local communities. 

In the first six months of the pandemic, food banks in the Trussell Trust network gave out a staggering 1.2 million emergency food parcels. That’s one food parcel every 13 seconds, and 2,600 of these went to children every day on average.

Over a year later, things are still very difficult for a lot of members of our communities, and foodbanks have been a lifeline for a lot of people during these difficult times.

Instead of asking people to donate items to our foodbank drive in the office as we have done in previous years, this year we are doing a virtual collection. All donations made through our fundraising page will go directly to the Glasgow South West Foodbank, so they can start using the funds immediately - any donation, big or small, would be greatly appreciated!

Description:
What is the Waterloo Foodbank?

The Waterloo Foodbank exists to provide 3 days of nutritionally balanced emergency food to local people in crisis.

They work with frontline care professionals to identify those in need. 

All food given out is donated by the public

ABOUT THE FOODBANK

They exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis – redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill – can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since their launch at the end of 2011 they’ve given away over 90 tonnes of food to over 11,000 people in need, including over 4,000 local children.

They are part of The Trussell Trust’s UK-wide foodbank network, and together they provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at Oasis Playspace, Chapter 1 and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

Help us to support the fantastic work of the Waterloo Foodbank!

Description:
It's always one of our favorite times as a community, when we gather together, in order to raise funds for important causes. This year, we'll be joining forces online to raise money for the Horsham Foodbank.

Just lately, Horsham District Foodbank has had many appeals from those who have just been made redundant, were not entitled to redundancy pay and are struggling to make ends meet.

The average cost of a emergency food parcel of 3 day's food is £15 for one person for long-life food only. Supplemented by donated fresh food, this makes such a difference for someone with no money to buy groceries. Demand has risen by 100% and every penny donated will support someone who needs it, in our local community.

Sat 13th Feb - 9.30 - 10.30am
Sign up for free at heartspaceyoga.org

Title: Holtwood Road supporting Burngreave Foodbank

Description:
A plea for support

At Keighley Salvation Army we work with several individuals and families in need of help with food and toiletries. The food bank has been running for over 20 years and on an average week we would hand out around 30 – 35 parcels. We also support several Asylum seekers and refugees each week with
food, clothing such as school uniforms and travel costs.

However, since the start of the pandemic in 2020 the need for food parcels has grown. Working alongside other food banks and support agencies working in Keighley and the surrounding area well over 2,500 parcels have been delivered or given out. This increase is due to illness, job loss, people isolating, changes to benefits and many other valid reasons why people are struggling and need of support.

As always, our supporters have been very generous with donations of food and money to keep our food bank stocked but we are now beginning to run low on many items.

If you can help us by donating, we would be extremely grateful.

Thank you.










 




  



 




﻿﻿
  





  



﻿

Title: RigNet Aberdeen Foodbank Fundraising Appeal

Description:
East Bristol Foodbank provides emergency food parcels, budgeting advice and debt support to people living in poverty.

There often seems there is not much we can do when our Government votes to not feed hungry kids. We can however help local organisations to continue to do the incredible work they do.

I'm raising money for East Bristol Foodbank and your contribution will make an impact, whether you donate £1 or £100. Every little bit helps. I've included information about East Bristol Foodbank below.

Every day people in the UK go hungry for reasons ranging from redundancy to receiving an unexpected bill on a low income. Trussell Trust foodbanks provide a minimum of three days emergency food and support to people experiencing crisis in the UK.

All food is donated by the public and sorted by volunteers. Frontline care professionals such as doctors and social workers identify people in crisis and issue a food voucher. Clients receive three days of nutritionally balanced, non-perishable food in exchange for their food voucher. Foodbanks also make time to chat and to signpost clients to other helpful services.

Hunger is not just a third world problem. Today people across the UK will struggle to feed themselves and their families. Redundancy, illness, benefit delay, domestic violence, debt, family breakdown and paying for heating during winter are just some of the reasons why people go hungry.

Description: One million meals! It's a staggering figure. And yet the reality is, based on our predictions, that it's the amount of meals S6 Foodbank will need to provide over the next year, to people in food emergency in Sheffield.From supporting around 150 people a week from 4 sites a year ago, the team are now supporting 1000 people a week from 9 sites. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. That's why I'm fundraising to support the work of S6 Foodbank.Thank you for supporting me - this donation is #ForAllSheffield
Title: Caitlin's Sponsored Silence - for S6 Foodbank

Description:
What else is there to do on a Bank holiday Saturday other than spend the morning rowing. I am going to attempt my first marathon that is 42,195 metres. The most I have ever rowed is a half marathon in one go. I think it will take about 3 hours 30 minutes to complete. Please support me by donating to North Bristol Foodbank.  

The Covid-19 crisis has pushed many families into hardship and exposed the severity of the UK’s food poverty problem.

The UK’s food poverty rate is among the highest in Europe. Despite being the sixth richest country in the world, millions are struggling to access the food they need.

Nearly six million adults and 1.7 million children were struggling to get enough food between September 2020 and February 2021, according to a report from the Environment, Food and Rural Affairs committee.

Giving up 3 or so hours of a Saturday morning  is just a small way in which I am able to contribute.

Thank you for your support.
Title: Simon's Rowing for North Bristol Foodbank

Description:
Harvest is a time of year when we come together and celebrate abundance of food by sharing with one another. This year Harvest looks quite different to previous years but the heart behind sharing and giving to one another still stays true.

Since April and all through the lockdown, the Southwark Foodbank has been delivering food parcels instead of people collecting them from centres and more than ever are relying on the public's support to keep the services running for even more people. In April alone, foodbank usage went up by 400% in Southwark.

To keep supporters safe, the foodbank is encouraging donations of Funds For Food, instead of physical food donations. 

Help us support the Southwark Foodbank with a small donation to keep them going strong as we head into Autumn and celebrate Harvest, giving to those in our community who might be struggling to afford food even more than normal because of COVID-19.

Thank you for supporting!
Title: Funds For Food - Harvest with Southwark Foodbank

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with

Description:
Every day people in the UK go hungry for reasons ranging from redundancy to receiving an unexpected bill on a low income. A simple box of food makes a big difference, with foodbanks helping prevent crime, housing loss, family breakdown and mental health problems.

We shouldn't need foodbanks in Britain, but we do and so I'm keen to help the Trussell Trust as part of my Booze-free appeal.  People shouldn't be in a position where they can't feed themselves or their children.  Your donations can make a difference to the Trussell Trust's hugely important work.

Did you know?

The Trussell Trust runs a network of over 400 foodbanks, giving emergency food and support to people in crisis across the UK, where thirteen million people live below the poverty line. In the last year they gave 1,182,954 three day emergency food supplies to people in crisis.

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

In the words of our founder Max.....

"This group was never about trade in the economic sense. It was always about humanity and it was always about love. And it was also about understanding that music is an *essential* element of our being human. We have every reason to think that communities have been singing, playing, drumming and dancing together for hundreds of thousands of years, with every song and beat binding people together, literally creating and perpetuating harmony across our planet.

In our modern world, and contrary to all our instincts, we have commodified our artistic output and although we have created great art, high and low, in the process, we have also forgotten that music belongs to us all. If you have ever felt like expressing yourself artistically but stopped because you felt that your art was not worthy, the Viral Jukebox is your home. I mean it.

More than once since I created this group people have suggested that I could find a way to monetise it. They are missing the point. The currency here is love. Spend freely. Give freely. And remember, if you sang or played it from your heart, you played it right."

So this Christmas, with the Pandemic rolling on and weird hybrid lockdown in place, we thought it would be great to raise money, together, for our favourite causes, so choose the one closest to your heart (or follow the person who made a song you like and vote for a cause they love!)

Happy Christmas Jukeboxers!
Title: Viral Jukebox Christmas Crackers - for the Foodbank

Description: We recognise the needs of the most vulnerable in our community who rely on food banks for safe, nutritious food. We hoping to raise a some money to assist people in need and the volunteers who run foodbanks across the country.
Title: Donate to South-West Belfast foodbank

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Saturday night BBO party Foodbank

Description:
I am crazily running the London Marathon again after saying never again after having a great experience with Di in 2018, then oh go on then this year, I finally got a place in the ballot. I'm training like crazy at the minute and would like to thank Simon, Red Rose and Team Tommy for all their running support. I don't need to raise the crazy 2.5k like last time but thought I'd try and do some good. I've set a £100 target to support the great local work of Blackburn Foodbank. If you'd like to sponsor me, no matter how small, I'd be very grateful and also send me lots of positive vibes. I'm doing 18 miles on my long run this weekend.


Thanks,

Andrea xxx


The foodbank was there when we really needed it, it was an absolute lifeline.We dont think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thats why we provide three days nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.We have recieved an unprecedented amount of referrals during the Covid19 Crisis. We don't want to see anyone without food during this challenging time. Your donations will help us to expand our service to meet the increasing need. Thank you
Title: Andrea's London Marathon Foodbank Challenge

Description:
Since the start of the pandemic foodbanks have constantly been in the news.  We have seen sharp increases in the need for food as a result of those struggling financially particularly in our own area of South-West Belfast.  For example our statistics show that from April 2020 to March 2021 we fed 6461 people of which 2758 were children, now that's startling, however it's been down to the generosity of the public and other donors like businesses, churches, schools, football and GAA clubs, corporates and many personal donations that we've been able to provide much needed assistance in the area.  We have been inundated with food and finance over the past year at the height of the pandemic and we feel privileged to be able to help many of those in need.  Indeed we have been a lifeline to many as some of those whom we have helped have said,  'you actually saved my life' and 'you have been so generous to me I just didn't know where to turn', and 'it's not just food, it's so much more than that'.

Of course our volunteers would love to continue this great work and serve their community as they have been doing so selflessly for the last 6 years.  We have a vibrant, hard working team that have a love for their community.

We don't receive any public funding and therefore we rely quite heavily on financial donations so that we can continue to help those in crisis.  Since the start of the pandemic we have seen many job losses resulting in a loss of income.  We have seen the result of sickness within families and how that has had a lasting effect in terms of loss of income.  We have seen many suffer with reductions in benefits, sanctions and many other variations of crises that have resulted in many of our people not even being able to afford the basics.  This is still the case today.

Our teams have willingly volunteered to run team relay in support of their foodbank and they hope that you can be an encouragement not only to them but to those members of the community sitting in silence, ashamed to come forward and ask for help.  They would say any contribution big or small is greatly appreciated and to those at home maybe afraid to ask for help please lift the phone and get in contact if you feel you cannot afford food.  South-West Belfast Foodbank are here to help.  

We have been privy to many wonderful outcomes for those who have needed to use the foodbank in gaining employment, winning long fought out benefit appeals coupled with major improvements to their mental health.  This is why we need to keep going.  Our community and the organisations that partner with us have recognised that we provide a vital service within the area and since the start of the pandemic we have been reaching far and wide with our efficient delivery teams putting in hours each week to deliver to those in need. We like to think that we provide comfort and a listening ear to those in crisis giving much needed advice whenever appropriate as we often find that not having enough food is only part of the problem.

We'd like to thank our running teams who are training hard to make their time and for their willingness to take part, but most of all we thank our generous community far and wide who have supported and continue to support the work of the foodbank.  We just ask that you help us out a little bit more so that we can provide much needed help where it is needed.

We are fast approaching the Christmas period and this is when we start to get busy.  We expect another spike in demand with many families expected to lose the Universal Credit top up, officially ending 6th October 2021.  This has been a lifeline to many.

Please help us to help others xx

This is what we all work towards and this is what we want #hungerfreefuture xxx

Edel Diamond

Foodbank Manager
Title: Donate to South-West Belfast Foodbank

Description:
Here at Carpenters, as part of our corporate social responsibility activity, we have been working with our staff to introduce food collection points in all six of our offices across the UK, including three of our offices based in Merseyside.

Once the donations have come in, we then distribute foodbank items to fans Supporting Foodbanks, a joint initiative between Everton (Est. 1878) and Liverpool (Spirit of Shankly) fan clubs and the Charles Thompson Mission in Birkenhead, just two of the wonderful volunteer organisations in the region who are working hard to supply basic provisions to those in need.

Since we started the initiative in September 2017, we have seen many people want to help but are unsure how so we have set up this page for those who wish to donate but we will also include any donations we might receive.

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children.

With the current coronavirus crisis, many vulnerable people are out of work and thus out of food. It's an incredibly challenging time in particular for at-risk communities who rely on the services of foodbanks - and those numbers are set to dramatically increase. Your support will be greatly appreciated.

The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks and together we provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

They are also greatly in need of volunteers at this time, so if you are healthy and able to spare some time, please sign up at: https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-involved/volunteer/
Title: Diana's Supporting UK Foodbanks through Covid-19

Description:
We exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis  redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill  can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since our launch weve given away over 100 tonnes of food to over 12,500 people in need, including almost 5,000 local children.

We are part of The Trussell Trusts UK-wide foodbank network, and together we provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at the Oasis Centre, St Johns Waterloo and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

We work with local frontline care professionals, such as schools, charities, housing associations, GPs, health visitors and churches, to identify those in need. They distribute vouchers that the client then exchanges for food. When clients arrive at the Foodbank, we offer them the chance to meet with
Title: Oasis Waterloo Foodbank - Covid19 Relief Fund

Description:
Westminster Foodbank was established in 2011 to help those living in poverty within the Borough. The poverty rate is 30% worse than is typical for London.

We support people on low income, those who have lost their jobs, those who have no recourse to public funds and many more.

We want to make sure everyone is able to have a meal and be able to maintain their dignity. We recognise that food is not the only essential items that individuals need so we provide where possible toiletries, nappies, feminine hygiene products and some household cleaning products.
Title: Luke's Clean Growth Christmas Party - Westminster Foodbank

Description:
We are the Preston Pantomime Group and today would normally have been our final dress rehearsal for our annual February half term panto. For the first time in 42 years the costumes and scenery remain silent and untouched in the cupboards! Sadly another casualty of COVID.

We have all missed each other’s company and all the last minute panic that the show brings. Of course we are really sad not to have been able to entertain you but also that we have not been able to support local charities as we usually do with our audiences help.

So, this is where we are asking for help from our lovely past audiences. Pretend you are still coming to watch but instead of paying for your ticket or your draw tickets or even your interval coffee  or ice cream make a donation to support our chosen charity, The Weymouth Foodbank.

Please help us to make a difference.

We would love your support to donate to this worthy cause. Every donation will make a difference.

Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us and the community. Now, more than ever, would your donation make a difference to local families.

Thank you
Title: Preston Pantomime Group supporting Weymouth Foodbank

Description:
The SPS Festive Foodbank Collection started in 2017 and has gone from strength to strength.  Last year, we raised a record £1,990 which was donated to the Trussell Trust to use in purchasing food items for XMAS hampers for families and individuals who are struggling to put food on the table at Christmas. 

COVID19 continues to present increasing challenges.  Yet, 6 October, 2021, saw the withdrawal of the £20-a-week COVID 'boost' to universal credit; it is estimated that this decision affected 4.4 million households, with 5.1m adults and 3.5m children seeing their incomes fall by £1,000 overnight. The furlough scheme has ended, and gas prices have shot up just when people started to put the heating on.

In this difficult context, Foodbanks continue to see an increase in people depending on them.

Throughout this last year, the North Bristol Foodbank alone provided 15,270 emergency food supplies to people in crisis.  Through this FESTIVE COLLECTION, we aim to show our support to this Foodbank, and to contribute to the much-needed XMAS hampers.

Title: Eat out to Really help out Foodbanks!

Description:
As the UK comes to terms with the Coronavirus outbreak what happens to the less fortunate? Over 14 million people in the UK already live in poverty and parts of Greater Manchester have some of the highest child poverty rates in the country. Many thousands of people in our communities already struggle to put food on the table.

Manchester Central Foodbank serve some of the most in need areas in Manchester such as Longsight, Ardwick and East Manchester and are already seeing increased demand due to Coronavirus. Those in insecure work and those already struggling to make ends meet may increasingly need somewhere to turn.

At the same time with localised shortages of some necessities there have been reports of drops in donations to foodbanks. Foodbanks need to replenish supplies themselves with cash donations.

If you feel like you want to do something to help the community during this worrying time please consider donating to Manchester Central Foodbank. £10 could provide a person with food for 3 days.

The foodbank is run by volunteers and all the money raised will go to buy food for those most in need. They intend to remain open to serve the community at this testing time. Lets help them with some donations so they can meet increasing demand.

Title: Cook Your Way Through The Lockdown: In Aid Of UK Foodbanks

Description:
﻿The Global Foodbanking Network helps save food waste by donating surplus food to people across the globe that need it the most. Due to a loss of jobs as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak, more people are using food banks. To meet this increased demand, the Network is partnering with local food banks across the world to feed disadvantaged people in over 43 countries.

How can you help?

Here at MUFG, we are holding an EMEA wide Workstation Photo Competition to support charities like the Global Foodbanking Network who are helping the most vulnerable at this time. To join the competition you will need to:

1. Take a photo of your work space.

2. Make a minimum donation of £10 (or the equivalent) to the Global Foodbanking Network.

3. Submit your photo to your local CSR champion.

Your generous donation will support the Global Foodbanking Network will help feed those most in need during these unprecedented times.

﻿For more information please visit www.foodbanking.org


﻿Thank you for all your support!

Description:
The Trussell Trust supports a network of 1200 food banks providing emergency food and support for than 14 million people living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. There are Trussell Trust centres near the University of Birmingham at Quinton and Cotteridge. In the last year the network provided a record 1.9 million food parcels.

Care professionals such as health visitors, teachers and social workers identify people in crisis and issue them with a food bank voucher. This means people can receive a food bank parcel of three days’ nutritionally balanced, non-perishable food from their local food bank.

If you feel generous and can afford to you can also set up a standing order for regular donations to our local foodbank in Quinton.

https://quintonoldbury.foodbank.org.uk/contact-us/

During lockdown Conny and I decided to donate monthly just what we saved on buying coffee each day to the Quinton foodbank and it came to a surprising amount that we could afford to give to a good cause.

Therefore, I’ve decided to set up this Just Giving page to support the amazing work done by the ‘Ormskirk Foodbank Charity’.  Charity No. 1185980.

Due to Coronavirus, it’s been reported there is still extra demand
on food banks and Ormskirk Foodbank are working now to help people in need of these services.  All money raised will go straight to Ormskirk Foodbank Charity account.

So, rather than going to the supermarket and buying extra
food & hygiene products, the best way would be to donate through this page. 

I’m kicking off the support with a donation of £250.00 

I fully understand with so many people being Furloughed by
their own employers, it is a tough time to ask people to donate, but “if” you have a spare £1 or £2, that’s enough to buy some tins of food… so let’s see how much community spirit we have here in Ormskirk and help those who need it most.

Finally, if you are wondering who and how this helps… Ormskirk Foodbank, working with doctors, health visitors, social workers and Citizens Advice, identify the people who need help the most and a foodbank voucher is issued.  The voucher is redeemed and
provides for three days of emergency food.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and stay safe & well.

Paul

Title: Prudens Financial Protection Ormskirk Foodbank Fundraising

Description:
To our loved ones,

We are very happy and grateful to be sharing this special day with you.

We consider ourselves extremely lucky to have been given loving families, close friendships and good health.

For this reason, we would like to use our wedding day as an opportunity to help improve the lives of others.

Instead of gifts for us, please consider making a donation to one or both of our two chosen charities. 

The charity chosen by Jon is the Manchester Central Foodbank.

Founded in 2013 by a group of students connected with the Manchester University Catholic Chaplaincy, they provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people in crisis.  

620,000 people in Greater Manchester are living in poverty and struggling to put food on the table, of which around 200,000 are children. One in four parents across the country have skipped meals to make ends meet and for schoolchildren, “holiday hunger” is a growing concern.

We hope you will support this great cause!
Title: We are raising money for the Manchester Central Foodbank

Description:
Bearsden West Community Council is proposing that we as a Community set up a foodbank collection point in the local area to serve the Glasgow NW foodbank. Studies have shown that people are more likely to donate food if donation points are local. Currently, there is no collection point in Westerton.

With the introduction of Universal credit to Glasgow by December 2018 resources at centers are becoming stretched. Last year in NW Glasgow alone nearly 9000 people used the foodbank, over 4x the population of Westerton. This is unacceptable in the society we live in.  

Therefore we are asking, especially in the run-up to Christmas, for donations of the following items:

[CLICK HERE FOR SHOPPING LIST] 

For those who would not be able to make food donations we will also be collecting funds which can be donated securely online on this page. 
I hope we as a community can make this a regular thing and we can make this Christmas drive the start of something bigger.

If you have any questions you can contact us at: bwcc@westertonvillage.org.uk or the food bank directly at: info@glasgowNW.foodbank.org.uk


Thanks a million for your support!
Title: Bearsden West Community Council Foodbank Appeal

Description:
From now until Pancake Day (16 Feb) I am raising money for the Lewisham Foodbank via recipe sharing. 

Each day I will be sharing a recipe on the instagram page #leftoversrecipeshare which is good for using up leftovers  (and feel free to comment with any of your recipes too - the more the better!).  

If you see a recipe on the insta page that you like then please make a donation here in return.  The Lewisham Foodbank has never been busier and winter is an especially challenging time.  Any and all donations are very gratefully received.  

If you would like to learn more about the Lewisham Foodbank then do visit https://lewisham.foodbank.org.uk.  You can find out more about how to donate food or volunteer there too.

I hope you enjoy a new dish, and thank you so much for all your support.

Candy
Title: Leftovers Recipe Share Fundraiser for Lewisham Foodbank

Description: Velocity's agency team will be raising money for Cambridge City Foodbank through ongoing activity taking place throughout the year. We would love your support!
Title: Velocity's Charity of the Year - Cambridge City Foodbank

Description:
No one should worry about where their next meal is coming from. 
Or whether or they will need to feed their children and go hungry themselves. 
Or choose between having a meal or heating their home. 

These are some of the situations many of our community face, especially in the winter months. 

To support local families, we are running our Feed a Family Christmas campaign, to support an additional 100 families in the borough with vouchers for food over Christmas, giving them dignity and choice, and helping to alleviate some of the financial burden that comes with the colder months. 

Help support our local community in Southwark this winter and Christmas period. Your donation could mean the difference between families going hungry and having enough food to see them through a hard time.
Title: Southwark Foodbank Feed a Family Christmas 2021

Description:
Thirteen million people live below the poverty line in the UK, with individuals going hungry every day. 

The Trussell Trust’s 400-strong network of foodbanks provides a minimum of three days’ emergency food and support to people experiencing crisis in the UK. In 2016/17, they gave 1,182,954 three day emergency food supplies to people in crisis.

Intelligent Data have set up a series of charity football matches for transport consultants, local authorities and related industries to generate much needed support for the Trussell Trust.

You dont need to take part in the football matches to donate and all donations no matter how large or small would be greatfully received.

In the lead up to Christmas, please donate to ensure people get the support they need.
Title: Intelligent Data - Pre-Christmas foodbank donations

Description:
Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks.

We say this because it’s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. That’s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by.

Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it – when we work Together for Change.

#TogetherForChange
Title: Capital Ring 78 miles for Foodbanks @ Xmas

Description:
The Dons Local Action Group (DLAG) have so far provided over 23,000 one-week food parcels across the boroughs of Merton, Wandsworth and Kingston. With more than 90 aid agencies making referrals, they are feeding people in food poverty who find themselves without any alternative solution. The end of lockdown is not the end for DLAG. As we return to normality, they continue to find ways to support those in need in our community. Now with over 1,400 volunteers, DLAG has brought local communities together across South-West London and is changing lives for the better.

In the run up to Christmas, the Willmott Dixon team working on the Somerset Road Covered Courts project are keen to help out and raise funds  to support those most in need within the London & South region.
Title: WDC L&S Christmas Foodbank Appeal

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.  

During the COVID-19 Pandemic, we have seen unprecedented demand for our Foodbank.  Please help us to help the local community by providing food for those who are unable to supply al that they need.  Thank you.
Title: Stockton Citadel's COVID-19 Foodbank Appeal

Description: We have chosen to donate to The Trussell Trust an NGO and charity that works to end the need for food banks in the UK. It supports a network of over 1,200 food bank centres to provide emergency food and compassionate, practical support to people in crisis, while campaigning for long-term change to the structural issues that lock people into poverty.
Title: Upfields Charity Foodbank Fundraiser UK&I

Description: The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.
Title: Populations Bake Sale for The Felix Project FoodBank

Description:
We are school friends who are taking part in the Bronze Duke of Edinburgh Award. We are collecting for the Norwood Foodbank as our volunteering activity. We were inspired by our neighbour who started the foodbank collection on our street when he was carrying out the same scheme.

We are really looking forward to collecting for and supporting the Norwood & Brixton food bank through food donations. We are collecting donations from our neighbours. We plan to carry out the collections fortnightly on Monday evenings, starting on Monday the 22nd February. 

We have set up this justgiving page for those of you who would like to help support food banks financially. The Trussel Trust supports foodbanks nationally in the UK.

This is extract below is from the TrusselTrust:

Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because it’s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. That’s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by. Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it – when we work Together for Change.#TogetherForChange

Description:
Hi all!

It's my birthday in June and, inconveniently for me, the world is on fire.

So instead of buying me a pint, why not chuck a pint's worth of donation to FareShare South West? And if you weren't going to buy me a pint, why not donate anyway? Then reward yourself with a nice pint.

I'm not going to do the spiel about why FareShare South West are so super great, their website does that very well: 

https://fareshare.org.uk/fareshare-centres/south-west/

Suffice to say, if you enjoy food and feel in any way strongly that people should have access to it, you can help make that happen by sending them some money. They do a great job of sending meals to shelters, refugee centres, addiction agencies and loads more. 

Basically, if you send Fareshare money, they will turn that money into FOOD. Incredible.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The LUFC Supporters' Trust, through its 'Leeds Fans Food Bank' initiative, supports the Leeds South and East Food Bank and the Leeds North and West Foodbank.  We shouldn't need food banks in 2020, but we do, more than ever. I'm 55 and about 3 stone overweight. I shouldn't need to do 'Couch to 5k' in 2020, but I do, more than ever.

I've been doing this 9 week 'running' challenge and trying to raise funds for this important cause at the same time. It might put some meals on the tables of some people who really need them, and it might help change a few lazy perceptions of football fans and what they care about. It might lower my blood pressure and my cholesterol levels too.

It's actually 11 weeks (icy roads, work and a few aches and pains spread it out) but today I completed the last run of 5k. Going out in some grim weather at times has been made easier knowing kind people are donating to this good cause. This would have been easier in summer...

People supporting this small challenge have donated £575 to support the Leeds Fans Foodbank - I'm very grateful to everyone who contributed. I'll stop seeking further donations in the next day or so.

Thanks to @riotbadger for confirming this was a half-decent idea and to @lufctrust for encouraging me when I asked if it would be possible.
Title: Chris's Couch to 5K for Leeds South and East Foodbank (@LeedsFansFoodbank)

Description: East Bristol Foodbank provides emergency food parcels, budgeting advice and debt support to people living in poverty.
Title: KPMG's Christmas 2021 collection for East & South Bristol foodbank

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: clare's South Essex College supporting FE Foodbank Friday

Description:
During the pandemic I have been finding ways to support and help others using my love of sewing. Initially I made uniform bags and scrubs for my NHS colleagues to keep them safe and then somebody asked me if I could make some face coverings for them to buy. I was happy to make them free of charge, but asked for a donation to a food bank so that others in need could benefit instead. 

Since then I have had numerous requests to make more face coverings and the requests are coming think and fast now that the Government have said that face coverings will be mandatory from 24th July. 

I will be making more over the coming days and will post pictures of the ones available. Due to current demand I am no longer able to make bespoke designs. What you see is what you get - .hope you understand!  If you see one that you would like then please let me know,  make a donation to this page. and I will then make arrangements for get it to you.

Please note  - the face coverings are made from 2 layers of fabric and are not therefore a ‘medical grade’ mask. They are designed to limit the spread of droplets that may transmit COVID 19 and there is no guarantee that they will prevent you from catching the virus from others. They should be washed daily at 60 degrees.  Social distancing and hand washing should still be carried out as per public health guidelines as these are the best methods to prevent infection currently available. 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Zayd and Anam 

"Last  year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description:
The Salvation Army works with some of the most vulnerable people in society. Coming out of the worst public health crisis in our lifetime and with prices rising, people on the margins need us now more than ever.
 
At Openshaw we run an emergency food bank for people in crisis along with support with form-filling, job hunting, a listening ear and endless brews and prayer!  We'll do what we can.  Maybe you can help.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

Description: It is Sadaka's mission to prevent and relieve poverty and financial hardship in Reading by providing food, clothing and basic household items to individuals in need, and by supporting other organisations which work to prevent or relieve poverty in Reading. We are in our third year as a charity and have already seen some individuals get into accommodation and work. Supporting people with complex issues is not easy, but we have wonderful volunteers who come from all walks of life who make our work possible.
Title: E2open Ltd - Support for Sadaka Foodbank Charity - Reading

Description: Thank you for supporting S6 Foodbank. Every donation made goes directly to support their work. Without the assistance of people and businesses in Sheffield, S6 Foodbank wouldn't be able to continue to support their guests, launch new sites and tackle the ongoing food crisis in Sheffield which is being exacerbated by coronavirus. S6 Foodbank are expecting the increased need to continue for the foreseeable future, as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. A donation of £27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three for three days. I am aiming to raise at least £40 to help S6 Foodbank reach their £40,000 target. Whatever I raise (up to that target) will be match-funded by the Government via the Love Your Neighbour partnership, meaning S6 Foodbank receives double the amount. Thank you for donating, and a huge thank you too from Chris and the team

Description: One million meals! It's a staggering figure. And yet the reality is, based on our predictions, that it's the amount of meals S6 Foodbank will need to provide over the next year, to people in food emergency in Sheffield. From supporting around 150 people a week from 4 sites a year ago, the team are now supporting 1000 people a week from 9 sites. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. That's why I'm fundraising to support the work of S6 Foodbank. Thank you for supporting me - this donation is #ForAllSheffield
Title: #ForAllSheffield - fundraising to provide 1 million meals!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Many of you will have followed my 500km walk last year and a huge thank you to those that donated towards a total £4530 along with my own donation from every completed house sale. This far exceeded my target of £1500 so I began to think what can I do to better this in 2022.

Well, I have taken the not so easy option of doubling the distance to 1000km and will start again on January 1st. Clearly I have a business to run and have to be mindful that my clients expect me to give 100% of my time during those working hours to them and I will continue to do so. This of course means that my walking will have to take place very early in the morning or late at night so every walk apart from the weekends will have to be in the dark. However, I am hoping that the Covid situation will at some point allow many more people to come and join me whenever they feel like doing so. If this is the case then I will fix a regular walk for people to do just that or join for even part of that days walk.

At 57 it didn't take me long to add those extra pounds that I lost during last years walk so it will be good for my own health too. 

I will continue to make sure that a walk takes place every single day come rain, shine, snow and those winds that I experienced last year. Occasionally I will be outside of Weymouth due to social events and family visits but will still get a walk in and post the photos. I am hoping to be in Hamburg, Germany for a couple of days in March so that will be a good one along with visits to London along the way.

Once again I will be donating £50 for every completed sale throughout the whole of 2022 and hope that we can smash the total achieved in 2021. I have doubled my target amount and crossing everything that we manage to support such an amazing group of people that run the Weymouth Foodbank for so many people who are reliant on them throughout the year in Weymouth and Portland.

Thanks again to your support last year. Lets do it again together

Jon

Together we can help Black Country Foodbank relieve the stress of parents who are going without so they can feed their children, and give hope to others who have fallen on hard times. Title: Natilik's Food Bank for NYC Support

Description:
Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) jointly with Bradford Central Lions Club launched its Food Bank in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system. Some of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy, thereby gaining reward from Allah (SWT).
Donate from as little as £5 per month or £30 to provide one food parcel

Title: In memory of Sally

Description:
Novus Property Solutions is pledging to donate £1,000 to a Stoke-on-Trent food bank as part of its 21 in 2021 campaign. The campaign aims to get 21 local businesses to make the pledge to keep effectively supporting struggling people throughout 2021 and beyond.

Novus is shocked to learn that the enormous cost of operating a food bank works out to approximately £140,000 per year! It is because of this, we wanted to do our part to help keep this fantastic service running. 

Today, the Stoke-on-Trent food bank feeds 14,000 people per year, making it a vital service in the community.

All Novus employees, clients and suppliers have been encouraged to get involved and support this great cause.

Description:
Manchester University Geographical Society (MUGS) aims to bring together all undergraduates, postgraduates and staff in the Geographical community to both socialise and broaden our geographical knowledge. Geography sits within the School of Environment, Education and Development (SEED). 

SEED is one of four schools within the Faculty of Humanities at the University of Manchester. SEED’s core aim is to understand and improve the uneven relationships between society, economy and the environment.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, MUGS and SEED have combined our fundraising efforts and are dedicating our time to helping out communities in Manchester which have been hit by the pandemic. Please either donate monetarily or through food and other items in the Chaplaincy on Oxford Road (in between the Church and KroBar)

Title: Addleshaw Goddard's fund raise for Glasgow South East Foodbank

Description:
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, and preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

Glasgow Clyde College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to support people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our communities.  We have the resources and the fantastic staff and students to make it happen.

That is why we are joining the FE colleges nationally in the FE Foodbank Friday Initiative.  Since the programme started on 20 March, many colleges across the UK are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate items.  That is why we are joining this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise £1,500 so that Glasgow food banks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place.

We are asking for donations during this very difficult time to ensure we come through the crisis together.  All donations will be shared equally across all four Glasgow Food banks - North East, North West, South East and South West.

Thank-you for your donation.
Title: Glasgow Clyde College supporting FE Foodbank Friday Initiative

Description:

﻿﻿﻿Trussel Trust food banks in the Bristol area include:

Bristol NorthWest - St Andrew's Avonmouth

North Bristol - Ebe & Revive Charity shop Filton Ave, St James' Lockleaze, Greenway centre Southmead

East Bristol - St Mark's Easton, Fishponds Baptists, Bourne Christian Centre Kingswood.

﻿﻿﻿For less than a latte you can help our friends who are less fortunate. Text BCMS99 £2 to 70070 to support the Trussell Trust

Title: Ian's Stepping out for S6 to raise money for the Sheffield Foodbank

Description:
Dear all,

In 2008 when I started working for the RDS I had no idea that I would stay for this long. Two kids and PhD later, I have quite literally grown up with this job!

As some of you know, we are emigrating to Kuala Lumpur at the end of July. 

So, here we are, nearly 12 years on, and almost the last 17 weeks have been in lockdown! It’s fair to say there will be no party. I feel sad that I won’t get a chance to say a proper goodbye to so many of you. Under any ‘normal’ circumstances, I would be planning an epic party to mark my leaving from the RDS EM but this is not going to be possible and the thought of a Locktini on Zoom fills me with cringing awkwardness 

So, I would like to ask for your help instead so here’s my story…

Since lockdown one thing that has helped me to retain my sanity and happiness (whilst home schooling a 4 and 7 year old and working) is cooking and eating with my family. I believe that food influences our moods, our physical recovery and brings a focus to the day.

But whilst I have been enjoying delicious homemade food, I have also been reflecting on how privileged I am to buy the ingredients I need and have heating facilities to cook food with. My eyes have been opened even more since I started volunteering in March at a local foodbank in Leicester. I help, with other volunteers, to make food and sanitation parcels.

So many families have been struck further into food poverty since COVID-19. 

This foodbank like many others relies solely on donations from Fareshare, the goodwill of community leaders and local people, so that local families don’t go hungry. 

It’s been thoroughly enjoyable and inspiring working with you all. I’ve learned so much and leave with very happy memories. My last working day is the 8th July. 

Please keep in touch, add me to your LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/raksha-pandya-wood-79204733 or just drop me an email: rpandyawood@gmail.com

Take care and stay safe

Raksha Pandya-Wood
Title: Raksha's leaving do 'drinks' for the COVID-19 FoodBank @ChristTheKing

Description:
Hi everyone 👋

I'm doing my first 7-Day extended fast from Friday 26th March.

I've decided to try and raise money for a food bank in Belfast, they are an amazing group and help people so much, even more so now with the struggles of living in these times.

I'll post up how I prepare for a fast and I'll also keep you updated at the end of each day, showing the benefits and different stages of fasting (in case anyone is interested 😊).

If I don't make it the full 7 days I'll donate £20 for each day although I'm sure this won't be necessary.

If you wish to sponsor me or donate anything at all that would be amazing, even something small is greatly appreciated!

Can my friends and family please share this post for me.

Thanks :D

*Edit* A few people are concerned so just wanted to explain that what I'm doing isn't dangerous if done correctly. I've practiced this for nearly 6 months now, I'm also fat adapted so I burn fat instead of glucose for fuel. Fat lasts much much longer and gives the body what it needs when you can't eat. This is similar to the ancestral human diet and is what would've happened if they were unable to hunt anything for days. After a certain period of fasting your body enters into autophagy, where your cells recycle and rejuvenate and get rid of any bad cells. This is normally the aim for someone doing an extended fast and it's amazing. So please don't be concerned, I know what I'm doing and there'll be no harm done :)
Title: Jack's 7 Day fast for South-West Belfast foodbank

Title: St John Sandiway Singalong - Donations to Mid Cheshire Foodbank

Description:
Thank you to everyone who has donated to this campaign, without the support of so many of you we would not have been able to continue, launch new sites and ultimately address the immediate food crisis caused by coronavirus.

As the coronavirus crisis has continued, we have experienced a huge increase in need. To illustrate this, prior to the crisis our busiest week was in December 2019, where we supported 117 individuals and families across four foodbanks.  In the last week of April 2020, just one of our seven foodbanks supported 126 individuals and families. This increase in need means our weekly food bill would be almost £8,000, should we need to purchase it, not to mention staffing, transport and equipment.  

Sadly, we are expecting this increased need to continue for the foreseeable future as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences.  We still don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That’s why we asking you to support us to continue to provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food to local people, in the initial crisis, through 2020 and beyond!

Sometimes the numbers involved can seem daunting so we’ll make it simple - £27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three.

Thank so much for all your support, love and encouragement – S6 foodbank!

Description:
Last year, food banks in the Trussel network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis.  More than half a million of these went to children. It’s rotten that people can’t afford the basics - and at this time its worse for many. No one should be left hungry or destitute. Jack Monroe was ( not for the first time ) an inspiration. https://uk.gofundme.com/f/help-foodbanks-feed-people-during-coronavirus

Title: Head Shave Live: Spontaneous Foodbank charity haircut next Sunday

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We recently attended and Anti Poverty evening in Kirkcaldy and I was shocked to find out that Kirkcaldy foodbank alone spend £8000 per month on food! Run by 100 volunteers. More than one third of those who receive support from Kirkcaldy foodbank are children. 8650 food parcels per month are given out from Kirkcaldy foodbank. These figures left me feeling very sad and that I wanted to do something to help.

I know many of us have our kitchen cupboards packed so full that if we simply cleared away the tins of soup we aren't going to use, the pasta packets that we have 4 of along with the excess boxes of cereal we have never looked at. That we together could help these people and help Kirkcaldy foodbank, even if its a drop in the ocean for them.

That is why I am asking you all to please donate £5 worth of food from your cupboards, or £5 from your purse/ wallet.

In return, your name will be entered into our draw to win a kitchen deep clean inc oven clean to the value of £80. Once the draw ends I will pull one name from a hat and that lucky winner will receive this offer. You can enter as many times as you like. So go on, have that kitchen clear out and see just how much you have that can be donated, I bet its a lot more than you think!!!

Thank you in advance,

Cara and all the team at Domestic Matters x
Title: Domestic Matters Kitchen deep clean give away

Description:
At this time of year, the people (and their family and friends) at AkzoNobel in Gateshead usually collect advent calendars and deliver to the Foodbank to distribute to families with children. 

This year, due to the restrictions that COVID-19 brings in terms of not being able to meet to collect calendars, I thought I would encourage you to donate to the foodbank direct to help them at a time when demand has increased significantly. In 2019, the Gateshead Foodbank provided 87 tonnes of goods to families in the area that needed it. By October 2020, they had already exceeded that total and delivered 97 tonnes.

Just £1 can allow the amazing volunteers at the Foodbank to provide an advent calendar for one child. They will also use any donations to help put together hampers so that families who struggle to make ends meet can still put food on the table during the festive season.

Anything you can spare would be amazing and will go a long way to ensuring that those in need get a bit of help towards the end of 2020.

Title: Louise's Consultations

Description:
In 2020, SGS UK employees raised a fantastic £833 for The Trussell Trust, with the Company matching and adding to this total so that SGS UK were able to donate £10,000 to this worthy cause.  With many people across the UK still needing the support of food banks, we hope to raise even more funds this year.  

The Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of food banks and together they provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

There are more than 1,200 food bank centres in the network, about two thirds of the food banks in the UK. They support these food banks to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis (for instance by advice agencies, GPs, social services and schools), as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face.

Any support you can provide would be greatly appreciated.
Title: SGS UK Fundraising for The Trussell Trust 2021

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether that’s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

As an education provider Loughborough College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to help people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to help make it happen.

That is why we are joining FE colleges nationally in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative. Since the programme started on Friday 20 March many colleges across the country are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise £2,000 so that foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

We are asking anyone willing during this extremely tough period to consider donating what they can to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.

Thank you so much for your kind donation.


About The Trussell Trust

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
