Description:
UPDATE: We have now completed the challenge....I can confirm that we made it safely to Newfoundland in the given time but will give a fuller update at the end of the week with exactly how far...

Thank you to those of you who have donated so far- we are thrilled to have made our fundraising target in supporting Portsmouth Foodbank. For those of you who have not yet donated, there is, of course, still plenty of time to do so.

From 23rd May, 16 tutors and two Heads of Year will be taking on an epic journey. The Middle School team will be attempting to cover the distance from Portsmouth Grammar School to Newfoundland, Canada- some 3935 km.

Over the course of a month the team will be running, cycling, walking, rowing- anything that can be measured safely whilst respecting current rules on social distance and exercise- in order to raise money for Portsmouth Foodbank. 

The Middle School team has always worked together very closely: our Common Room space acts as an important hub for staff as well as pupils, and we run a variety of fun events such as discos, the annual ski trip, our Little Canada adventure and, of course a number of charity  fundraisers. With this ethos in mind, each member of the team plans to contribute to the challenge in whatever way they possibly can, covering distances big or small using their own preferred method.

If we manage to complete the distance before a month is up we will keep count of kms covered and see if there are any other interesting landmarks we can get to. If we don't manage it, we will keep going and see how much longer after the month it takes. 

Finally, the serious bit: the coronavirus pandemic has placed unprecedented strain on foodbank services throughout the UK as more and more people find themselves in difficult financial positions as a result of the changing economic landscape. If you are able to, please do consider donating to support those most in need in our community.

Title: PGS Middle School journey to Newfoundland

Description:

Greenwich Foodbank don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That’s why they provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

This Christmas we have chosen to support local. According to recent research, these smaller, local charities have been hit the hardest by the pandemic. 

We are suggesting everyone who takes part makes a minimum donation of £2 but please do give generously if you can.

Description:
Ay up mi duk! We're the Calverton Plough Boys. 

We perform a traditional St George's mummers play on the nearest Saturday to St George's Day every year to raise funds for charity ...

... but this year the pubs are shut. 

Ah bum. 

So, instead, we've made a silly film to replace this year's live performance, spliced together from our various places of isolation. We'll be inflicting it on the World Wide Web on Saturday 25 April. We already feel very sorry for you.

Please watch and share the film to literally millions of your friends on social media. Be sure to also share our fundraising link, and donate a few quid to Arnold Food Bank, our chosen charity this year. 

Visit: www.calvertonploughplay.co.uk for more info, and to see the film when it's released!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

﻿﻿Over 90% of food bank stock comes from donations they receive from the general public.  During these unprecedented times the need for food parcels has increased but the donation rate has fell dramatically.  This means the amount of help which local charities can give to the most vulnerable in our local area has fell when it's needed most.

Gateshead food bank also provides essential non food items such as toiletries and female hygiene products. 

Gateshead food bank will provide a 3 day supply for either individuals or families that need their help.

They urgently need our help both during and after this pandemic.  Can you help?  If everyone donated the pennies for just a tin of beans, imagine the difference we can make!

Description:
It's my first birthday on May 9th! I wish I could be spending it with my friends and family having a great big party, but because of this horrible virus I will be separated from my loved ones. I am a very lucky boy who has lots of lovely things and people keep asking my mummy and daddy what I would like for my birthday. What I'd really like is to be with those I love, but I can't. So what I'd really like is for everyone to have a garden party at their home and to donate any of the money that would be spent on travel, presents or food contributions to go to the Stockport Food bank. 

I'd also love people to send lots of pictures of themselves having loads of fun at my great big party, and now it doesn't matter how far away you are we can all have a big party together on May 9th. 

Stockport food Bank provides support and food parcels across Stockport, providing food to people in crisis.

Description:
Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks.

We say this because it’s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. That’s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by.

Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it – when we work Together for Change.

#TogetherForChange

Description:
Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) launched its Food Bank Project in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system and especially now due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Most of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. 

We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy, thereby gaining reward from Allah (SWT).

Donate from as little as £5 per month or £30 to provide one food parcel.

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

In Hythe, we've been active as a Church and serving the community for nearly 125 years, including through the provision of practical support in times of need. In recent days our foodbank has seen a spike in usage and individuals are finding it difficult to get out of the house to donate food. We've set up this page so that people can make a monetary donation which can be used to purchase food.

S6 Foodbank are expecting the increased need to continue for the foreseeable future, as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. 

A donation of £27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three for three days. I am aiming to raise at least £40 to help S6 Foodbank reach their £40,000 target. Whatever I raise (up to that target) will be match-funded by the Government via the Love Your Neighbour partnership, meaning S6 Foodbank receives double the amount.

Thank you for sponsoring me, and a huge thank you too from Chris and the team

Title: In memory of our dearly loved friend and colleague Emma Fitchett

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page 

Last year I decided to support my Muslims students by committing to do half of Ramadan with them. The experience gave me an insight into the difficulties faced by many who have access to little food on a day-to-day basis. This insight has motivated me to try to complete the full 30 days this year to support both my students and charities who work to ease the impact of food poverty in the local area. I will be collecting donations for the foodbank whilst I complete my fast so please have a dig in your cupboards for tinned/packeted food, go out and spend a pound on some food or send some money my way to purchase some food on your behalf. I will happily come and collect donations so please let me know if you have anything to give. I've already had £20 off some lovely people to set the ball rolling ❤️

38% of households in Stoke-on-Trent are living on less than £16,000 per year (the minimum amount required to access basic goods and services in Britain. Hardship Commission – Stoke-on-Trent, 2015).

Description:
Dear friends and colleagues, 

Welcome to our third annual winter fundraiser! Last year we raised £500 for Jimmy's homeless shelter, so we hope we can top that! This year we are raising funds for the Cambridge City Foodbank again. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Foodbank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. 

Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

1. Donate food. If you are based in the Department of Archaeology, please take part in our food drive. There is a box in the coffee room for supplies and updated shopping lists alongside it.

2. Donate money using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Thank you for your donations!

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.


The Urenco team have come together in support of the West Cheshire Foodbank, who provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. In these uncertain and unprecedented times we currently find ourselves in,  the Foodbank is being pushed to its limit in terms of resource and supplies, and we felt we wanted to play a small part in trying to support this worthy cause.



The team will be refraining from shaving during the lock down period and in return for enduring the itchiness and discomfort as well as the disapproval of our respective partners, we simply ask for a donation, however small, so that West Cheshire Foodbank can continue to perform their vital work. Anything you can give will be put to good use helping those that need it most. 

Thank you
Title: Urenco Group Procurement COVID-19 No Shave-a-thon

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We as a local community studio based in Brockley, London SE4 wanted to support a local charity during this time and so our team of experienced yoga and pilates teachers will be holding a Yogathon for Lewisham food bank on the 2nd May 2020.

The food banks provide food parcels to be delivered to those in need. People that live in poverty as well as the vulnerable that are isolated. 

During the event our team of teachers will be holding an event in which all the experienced participating teachers will teach a segment of a longer class. It will be a way of connecting our community that since going fully virtual has expanded to people all around the world. It will also be an opportunity to experience all our amazing teachers in a single afternoon during what could be a really crazy random class. 

If you wish to be involved you can either sign up for the event and donate directly or even get sponsored for your participation. If you are not able to participate but would like to donate directly please do. It will not be easy as it will be about 2 hours long but will be a lot of fun!!!. You can rest as much as you need so don’t be too scared of joining in and looking after yourself during the event.

Please support us, to support the food banks as during this time the poverty and hardships that people are experiencing are even more prominent than usual.
Title: Renaissance Yogathon

Description:
The Lewisham foodbank is run by local people for local people – they rely on the community’s support to ensure they can continue to stop people going hungry. 

50% of my revenue from online teaching during the Covid-19 crisis will go to Lewisham Food Bank to provide emergency food supplies to people who need it most.

4327 three-day emergency food supplies were given to people in crisis last year. An emergency pack contains three-days’ nutritionally balanced, non-perishable tinned and dried foods

During this time especially, there are many people in need of emergency food supplies. Please donate whatever you can (even £1 helps) or to your local food bank. 

Find your local food bank: https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/

The Morecambe Bay food bank is a necessary lifeline that is facing ever-growing demand. In the first period of this year, they saw a 27% increase in the number of clients coming through their doors, with a large increase of those donations being used to support children.

A food raise will be held in Alexandra square on Tuesday, 07/05/2019 where we will collect a number of items, from non-perishable food to toiletries and cleaning products. We have also set up this just giving page as the food bank relies on monetary donations to by items that are needed but aren’t often donated.
Title: Morecambe Bay Food raise

Description:
The challenge: To notice one small thing/detail in my environment each day this month and to share it on the Facebook page, as either a photo, tiny piece of art or haiku. Some of these may be wonderful, some may be terrible. The idea is to do it and share it regardless!


Why: Over the last 2 years or so, illness and disability have left me almost housebound and needing a lot of time in bed.
I've decided I need to set myself one tiny, manageable creative goal each day to stop life just passing by in a blur.

At the same time I still want to find ways to contribute to my community and to things that mean a lot to me.
Combining my little daily goal with a fundraiser seemed one way I could do that.

If you'd like to follow along, whether you donate or not, please come and visit the Noticing September Facebook page 

https://www.facebook.com/Noticing-September-108538293858525/

Thanks xx

Title: Aria&Azkas 300K STEP CHALLENGE

Description:
June 2020 during a global pandemic I woke up inspired to do everything I have never done before... make ME happy. I’ve spent the last 4/5 years unhappy with my; motivation, fitness, weight and just all round mental health. I’ve tried every diet going and been to the gym a million and one times yet still was getting nowhere. One evening after work I thought F*** THIS and downloaded the couch to 5k app, with some motivation from the mother in law that she’d do it with me, out we went. 


I’ve not stopped since.


After 9 weeks of the couch to 5k I continued to run 5k for a minimum of 3 times a week, occasionally adding a 4th in to challenge myself. As months went by I decided to increase the km’s and keep pushing myself and my body to it’s fullest potential. It actually blows my mind what you can put your body through, no matter how tired you are or if your body aches. 


The time I spend running is the time I spend on ME, and everyone deserves time spent on themselves. 


After years of not even being able to go into a shop alone without having a full blown panic attack I am challenging myself to run the potters arf marathon alone (I wanna be sick). 


After a colleague from work mentioned the Stoke-on-Trent Foodbank and what their charity stood for, it became clear that after the past 12 months this is the charity I wanted to raise money for. 


The Stoke-on-Trent Foodbank aim to provide 3 days of emergency food to those who are in crisis either due to; poverty, sudden loss of income, bereavement, domestic violence, illness and other crisis within their family. 

Their services include; money or debt advice, specialist housing support, mental health, drug and alcohol issues and social care. 


Highlighted above are just some of the services that COVID would of made 10x harder for families during this pandemic. 


With the help from my lovely family and friends I am hoping to raise enough money to help Stoke-on-Trent. Any money donated is very highly appreciated 🥺💘💘💘

Title: In Memory of Colin Parker

Description:
The Volunteering & Mentoring Team invites our University community to take part in this year’s 12 Days of Kindness campaign!

Designed to bring the season’s spirit of goodwill to the University and local community, this campaign will be taking place virtually on Tuesday 1st– Wednesday 16th December 2020 in aid of West Cheshire Food Bank.

With the help of a team of incredible UoC students, the annual 12 Days of Kindness campaign will be delivering a short series of virtual events and a photo competition to raise awareness and fundraise for a charitable cause to help those facing ‘Holiday Hunger’ this season.

Including a festive Netflix party, a Christmas card writing session and a jolly Christmas quiz, the campaign brings our community together in a fun, interactive way, whilst asking those who get involved to simply donate what they can and spread the word.

  • Christmas Card Writing - Wednesday 2nd December, 5.30pm
  • Christmas Card Writing - Friday 4th December, 11.00am
  • Christmas Crafternoon - Monday 7th December, 2.00pm
  • Festive Meditation - Wednesday 9th December, 10.00am
  • Festive Netflix Party / Virtual Ski Chalet - Thursday 10th December, 4.30pm
  • Christmas Baking - Monday 14th December, 1.00pm
  • Christmas Quiz - Wednesday 16th December, 3.30pm

Make sure to also check out the 12 Days’ ‘Kindness Quest’ checklist and how you can take part in the #12DaysofKindness competition too! 

For more information and link(s) to the sessions, please email volunteering@chester.ac.uk!
Title: University of Chester's 12 days of kindness

Description:
The community of Alloway and Doonfoot are raising funds for the South Ayrshire Food Bank.

The pressure on the Foodbank has risen by 47% during this pandemic. The food contributions via Alloway Church Sunday collections have , coincidently, also risen by 47% but this still leaves South Ayrshire Foodbank struggling to feed families in need this winter. 

Giving financial assistance to the South Ayrshire Foodbank enables them to purchase essential items in greatest demand at this time.

Aldi at East Kilbride have kindly donated Kevin and members of his family to Alloway Parish Church to help raise further funds for the foodbank . By donating through the ‘JUST GIVING ‘ site you may have an opportunity to adopt  Kevin or one of his family members for Christmas. Any contribution, big or small, will make Christmas better for those less fortunate than ourselves.
Title: Dont leave Kevin Home Alone this Christmas!

Description:
Wellcome Genome Campus voted to support these two charities for the next two years...

Cambridge City Foodbank believe that no one in our community should have to face going hungry. Our fundraising efforts will help them provide nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Crisis offer help, advice and support (including training, education, health and wellbeing) to those impacted by homelessness - they helped more than 2,000 people over the Christmas period alone. Our fundraising efforts will help them continue to be there, side by side, every step of the way, until everyone has a place they can call home. See short films about their projects here.

Title: DataSpace's DataSpace Charity Month

Description:
As somebody who was lucky enough to be born round about this
time of year, December’s always been a month of receiving for me. This year I’d like to change that, and instead of receiving presents I’d like to give something back to a community that is now in need of help more than ever.

Having had a rather hedonistic time at uni (still embarrassed
about that time I ate a whole pasta bake for four in one sitting tbh), and in light of the political events of last week, I’ve been doing a lot of reflecting on my own relative privilege and the state of the world around me. You can’t really turn on the news, or go on social media without being reminded that the world is a Horrible Place, and there’s very little you can do about it. Bad people are in charge, everything is getting hotter, and I’m never going to reach 5’4”. It’s all very disheartening.

So if other people can’t make good things happen, I’m going
to try my very best to do it myself. During the pre-election madness, I saw numerous statistics on Twitter that really shocked me, and in particular quite a few on food bank usage in the UK. More people are using food banks than ever before, and this number has increased from the tens of thousands in 2010 to the millions this year. The reasons behind this increase can be disputed to no end, but I think regardless of political persuasion you can agree that they’re a
highly valuable resource for many. One that shouldn’t need to exist, but one that pretty much means life or death for those that need them.

For that reason I’d like to collect donations for the North
Bristol Foodbank this year, the foodbank that’s local to both myself and many of you that I know. There’s been a 54% increase in demand from North Bristol foodbank from April-Sept 2019, and as the winter draws in, the demand only increases. Christmas isn’t going to be the best time of year for many, and even if you can’t donate I hope you can keep them on your mind over the festive season.

I’ve created this page for any donations you’d like
to make! I would appreciate them much more than any Christmas/birthday presents (although if you’ve already bought them, I won’t say no…), and they’ll do much more good as well. Also, if you’re around to give me something in person, you have no excuse now 😊

Thanks!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my SECOND Just Giving page. With your help I have already raised over £500 for one Food charity; I would love to repeat that again this time for the Black Country Foodbank. 

Hello my name is Dillon and I am a student at Haberdashers Adams Grammar School. Like you I am worried about the effect Covid-19 is having on us all. I have seen on the news that many people are struggling with work meaning that they may not be able to buy food for their families and that is something I want to personally help with. I have done a charity car wash in my local area but now want to do something even bigger. 

So, I have decided to change the colour of my hair in support of the NHS. I am going to dye my hair in NHS Blue to show my appreciation for all the amazing work they are doing for us. All of the money raised will be used to buy as much food as possible. I hope that you will all support me in this worthwhile cause. 

I have already raised over £500 for another foodbank charity called The Trussell Trust; I would now like to provide the same help and support to Black Country Foodbank. I know that if we all come together we can not only achieve this goal but smash it.

Finally, please do keep looking back at this page for updates and pictures and don't forget to share with your family, friends and work colleagues.

Description:
Badreddin Salhani-Maat (17-11-1947 to 31-03-2020)


Bob was born in Syria and later reluctantly came to the UK to support his father to become a gynaecologist.  After a few years he decided to stay on in the UK while his family returned back to Syria.  He fell into a career as a maths teacher.   Despite his deteriorating vision he carried into his 50s. He was a kind hearted and generous man who touched many lives.  Nothing was impossible. He raised three independent children who will be forever grateful for all he did for them.  He acquired a few extra children who saw as equals to his own children.  He has four beautiful grand children who adore him.  He will be truly missed. 


Instead of flowers and cards, he would have preferred donations to those in need. He always enjoyed feeding the troops.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

 These are very uncertain trying times, and I know there are plenty of people out there who currently rely on the fantastic service their local food banks have to offer. Why am I doing this? Well, I've seen similar things happening elsewhere and whilst trying to find ways to help out locally I figured that sticking to what I am good at would be the best way to go. I enjoy photography, it’s a passion of  mine. I’m also what you’d call a social butterfly, so the two tend to go hand in hand.

During the current lockdown situation and the governments advice on social distancing I wanted to somehow document this on my one walk of the day, but also being productive. I'd like the opportunity to photograph you and your family from a safe distance, on your doorstep, pulling stupid faces at the windows, maybe doing cartwheels in the garden, what ever you're up for. And for just £5 you get a couple of photos to remind you of a time you're unlikely to ever forget and the Mid Cheshire Foodbank gets 100% of that fee. This isn't about work, more about keeping active and helping out. Thank you so much for your support and I hope to see you on my rounds. Much love to you all, Adam xx

These times would be hard for anyone, but especially those who have young families, and are finding it difficult to provide for themselves and their children. I don’t know about you, but as a young family myself who is able to support; there’s nothing worse than knowing of those who are not being able to provide for those we love and care for the most.

We here at PLS would like to help those most in need and make sure those families are able to go to places like the Black Country Food Bank, and make sure they have food on the table.

Title: Jade's Charity Quiz Night

Description:
**** Update: We are absolutely humbled by the generosity of our colleagues for this amazing donation drive.  Our target was smashed within the first 5 days! We will be accepting donations until 2pm on Friday 11th December and since we have 11 days to go we thought we’d stretch the target to £1500 and share this drive throughout Scotland. Teenagers are often not thought about for donation drives as the target tends to be younger children and the magic of Christmas, however our teens are in as much need. If you haven’t donated and would like to make a real difference in someone’s life please take the time to support this cause. ****

Christmas and the holiday season can be such a magical time for us all - but for those less fortunate it can also be a time of great sadness.

While we all celebrate, some may find themselves in a position where they are not able to afford any gifts for themselves or their love ones, and join in on the festivities. This, accompanied with potentially a lack of food to go around, can make Christmas a real struggle.

That's why we've teamed up with Glasgow South East Foodbank. At the Glasgow South East Foodbank, they aim to provide those in need, with a Christmas / Holiday food hamper, some small gifts such as shower gels, and ideally a £20 gift card to help during the holiday season.

To promote this cause, an aid our own wellbeing, four of us from the team will collectively walk 100 miles within a week, all while working full time, juggling childcare needs and the monotony of the tier 4 restrictions. From Monday 30th November to Sunday 06th December Graeme Davidson, Joe Simmons, Louise McShane and Connor Johnston will be walking during breaks, meetings (where possible) or just up and down the stairs when we get free time to get that step count up. Support us by supporting this amazing cause.

With our donations this year, we can help give as many teens a Christmas, and give them something to look forward to. Something we all desperately need this year.

We ask that you please consider donating this year. Any donations at all will make a huge difference to a teen in need, and struggling families.

Thank you to you all!


www.glasgowse.foodbank.org.uk

foodbank@glasgowelim.org.uk

Glasgow SE Foodbank Registered charity number SC043981


* While we have teamed up with Glasgow South East Foodbank to provide presents to teens, we cannot confirm that all funds will go towards presents, some funds may go towards gift cards, or additional food supplies. This will be decided at Glasgow South East Foodbanks discretion.
Title: Barclays' Give a Teen a Christmas

I decided on a local food bank as I trust the money will be used to help local families who are struggling. My first sober day is 24th Aug with my 100 days being up on the 1st Dec. Iv got the fear already just thinking about it 😬
Title: Craig's 100 days sober

Description:
There are things some people just can’t do.

But affording to feed themselves or their family should never be one of them.

The removal of the £20 Universal Credit uplift will plunge millions of people deeper into poverty. This creates an even greater strain on the food banks, and the reliance on our communities to support them.

Of all the emergency food parcels sent to people in crisis between 1 Apr 20 and 31 Mar 21, 980k were for children.

That represents nearly a million times parents couldn't afford to feed a child (and that's before the removal of the £20 UC uplift and the upcoming removal of the furlough scheme).

If you can, please consider supporting your local food bank by donating as little as £5 today.

Then challenge your friends to do the same, and try to say

Purple bulgarlal lalarm
Purple burgleryl alarm
Purple burglur raralarm
Purple burgalar alalm... burkulha
Purple burgularalarm
Purrkuhla...
Purple burglar larm
Purple burglar alarahm
Purple burgular alarm
purple burglerah alarm
purpelp burberp
Purple bur-burgular birkler burgerlalm

Easy!

Title: Stand Up Philosophy

Description:
For the third year running, The Wizards of Drivel Podcast is supporting foodbanks in Stoke-on-Trent.

Unfortunately, foodbanks have become invaluable resources in modern Britain. There were 4.3 million children living in poverty in the UK in 2019-20. That's 31 per cent of children, or nine in a classroom of 30.

Work does not provide a guaranteed route out of poverty in the UK. 75 per cent of children growing up in poverty live in a household where at least one person works. Often these people don’t have many people sticking up for them. It took a Premier League footballer to hold politicians to account for their failures in feeding the poorest children.

In a year where families felt the effects of the pandemic in their livelihoods, we are reminded about the extent of the problem, and the role foodbanks play in helping those who need that help. This is the case in Stoke-on-Trent.

Last year we raised an incredible £6,000. We’re not aiming to beat that this year - in fact - we’re not thinking in terms of targets. We’re just asking - if it’s at all possible to spare it - if folk could donate what they can to support this vital service.

Vis Unita Fortior.



*Statistics: Child Poverty Action Group
Title: The Wizards of Drivel - Christmas Appeal 2021

Description:
We are delighted that we are once again able to make our annual Christmas walk, this year in aid of the Black Country Foodbank, a brilliant charity which does great work supporting our communities and customers.

A group of whg colleagues will walk with some of our valued contract partners an 11-mile (17.7km) route from Walsall to Birmingham, ending the day at the world-famous Birmingham Christmas markets. Other colleagues who can't manage the whole route will take part in a relay-style walk of the same route, or of the local area, while others will fundraise in different ways.

As we weren't able to do the walk last year due to COVID-19 restrictions, we are hoping to smash our fundraising record this year and give back even more to our communities at what can be a really tough time.

Every penny counts, and we appreciate every donation.
Title: whg's Charity Christmas walk 2021 page

Title: Lewisham Food Bank

Description:
What is good food?

  • No takeaway 
  • No greasy, fatty, fried or sugary food including candy, fizzy drinks, cake, ice cream, sausages (oh god), bacon (man what are you doing to yourself) or and I cant believe I am saying it but melted/american cheese.
  • Must contain minimum of two veg or fruit (I will have to google what this is but i'm sure I can get some somewhere) 

To some of you this will seem trivial, silly or just plain stupid but to those of you that know me (well you probably thought I was describing myself) I am known and have been known for a long time as having the worst diet of anyone people know. Today I had macaroni and cheese with bacon two ways, fried onion and egg for breakfast followed by a burger king double rodeo burger with fries and 9 chicken nuggets for lunch and dinner will consist of pizza, garlic bread and Camembert just to give you a picture of the scale of the problem we are dealing with here. Knowing me I will also likely have a small (not so small) bowl of Crave at around 11pm just to ensure I don't get hungry during the night. 

What if you cheat? How will we know?

  1. When at work I will be having my breakfast and lunch in the office so I can be observed. 
  2. Each meal I will photograph as evidence 
  3. I will be stabbed each day at the same time! By this I mean I will have my sugar levels check each and every day of the month before work having taken an average reading over the next 5 days to prove I haven't cheated when I get home. I will also photograph these results on weekends and maintain the pictures as proof. 

Why should I care?..........1,000,000+ People!

Simple answer really people are starving! Over 1 million people now rely on food banks in the UK in order to survive in this country. Now....just take that in for a minute; in one of the worlds top 10 economies we are allowing more and more people every year to fall through the net, these are children, adults, elderly, poor and sick people who are already suffering from poverty in a top 10 economy! 

So even if you don't care about the reason I am doing this think about the cause! Even £2.50 can provide enough ingredients to allow 1 person to attend an eat well for less course. Just £10 can help provide food for a whole family in need! 

For me? 

This is hard! Some of you will run, cycle, climb or jump off something for charity and I applaud you for it.......but this is something that will affect me every minute of every day. I haven't changed my diet in 15 years. If it was easy I would have done it already!

Finally entertainment:

You sadistic people will no doubt enjoy the selfies of misery, daily stabbing I will endure and joy of eating a burger king right under my nose so give what you can and lets see how much we can raise and don't forget every few ££s we raise will mean someone in our community is not going to bed hungry! 

Thanks!

Josh
Title: Joshua 's Gluttony to Glory

Description:
On Sunday 5th April following cancellation of the Manchester Marathon my husband Brian Carroll ran amazing 105 laps around our 400m street loop covering his marathon distance. This inspired us to organise the Philips Walk and Wynd Ultra Marathon Relay for residents and fundraise for Hamilton District Foodbank raising money for those who may be in need during these challenging times.

On Easter Sunday starting  from 8am in 30 mins slots, 25  households, one household at a time, participants will walk/run/jog/scoot/bike around our 400m loop as many times as possible until 8:30pm in the evening. We expect to cover an ultramarathon distance of approx 40 miles. 

We would very much appreciate any donation however large or small  to help the local foodbank/community.

Description:
There are lots of things we will miss about rowing this summer: training with our friends; getting an awesome AIO tan; the excitement of racing and representing our college! But there is one tiny bonus, and that is we will save a bit of money through not taking part in races next term. So we have decided as a club, why not do some good with that instead? We would like to encourage our members, if able, to donate the cost of a post training brunch, or a race entry fee, or a celebratory beer, and together we can raise some funds for the Cambridge City Food Bank. 

Last year Cambridge City Food Bank provided 9,243 3- day emergency food supplies to families in crisis across Cambridge. With the current Covid-19 situation, that need is undoubtably only going to increase. For more information on the vital work this group does please visit https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk
Title: HHBC fundraiser for Cambridge City Food Bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!
Title: Steve and James do the 1,000 burpee challenge!

Description:
TARGETS

✅ £250 - right half of my beard and moustache

✅ £500 - right half my head hair

✅ £1,000 - my right leg hair

✅ £1,500 - my right arm hair (including pit)

✅ £2,000 - right half of my chest

✅ £3,000 - my right eyebrow

🎉 £5,000 - my entire right side (everything, front and back bottoms, the lot) all shaved. And I'll lay in a pool of cans of Tennent's Lager, with several differently sized balls with faces drawn on them, and say the line "it truly was a Shawshank Redemption". And get someone to take photos and stuff.

BONUS TARGETS

💻 £5,500 - shave an afternoon early during work (requested by Eilidh Mackay)

🍺 £6,000 - host a pub quiz on Zoom (requested by Eilidh Buckle)

🔵 £7,500 - face painted blue (requested by Chris Winch)

🏰 £̶1̶0̶,̶0̶0̶0̶ ̶-̶ ̶r̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶a̶ ̶b̶o̶u̶n̶c̶y̶ ̶c̶a̶s̶t̶l̶e̶ ̶(̶r̶e̶q̶u̶e̶s̶t̶e̶d̶ ̶b̶y̶ ̶B̶r̶u̶c̶e̶)̶
[too short notice and too wet for bouncy castle hire sadly]
🦱 £10,000 - make a half wig out of my own hair (requested by Jason & Selina Wagner)

🦨 £25,000 - dunk the skunk (requested by Lisa and Laura)

Whatever is raised by 30 October is how much hair I lose first thing the following morning. I promise to retain this look for no less than 24 hours. So give generously, but not tooooo generously. Please. JK. Let's raise a fartload.

If I do make it to the target, I may try and set up a live feed for you all to enjoy laughing at me as I get drunk and talk to balls. Now THAT'S a bachelor party!

Title: Andrew's going full Tandy

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My kids love Halloween trick or treating around Riverside View and it gets better every year! This year is different in so many ways but the kids have had enough taken from them. Lets keep the joy alive by decorating our houses as normal and also displaying a poster. Rather than trick or treating and giving out sweets, children can try and spot as many posters in windows/porches etc as possible. Our families remain safe and the children have a spooky trail to follow. How many posters will they spot? Plus, we can donate the money we would spend on sweets and treats to help those that have suffered during this difficult time. Win-win!

I have created the poster in black and white so that it can be coloured in by your little pumpkins (or yourself)! You can find the poster posted on the Riverside View residents only facebook group or left-click on the cover picture at the top of this page and save the image so you can print it out.
Title: Katy's Riverside View Halloween Trail 2020 page

Description:
Share a Cuppa Comfort with someone in need of a food parcel this Winter.

The idea behind the #shareacuppa campaign is to do what we do best when times are tough and reach out with a big mug of metaphorical love for someone who really needs a cuppa.

For the price of a cuppa tea you could help ensure someone is fed this Winter.

5 Cuppas = 1 3 day food parcel for a family of 4

Food poverty is a critical issue here in Birmingham, and numbers are soaring of those in need. At Aston & Nechells Foodbank we are providing near double our YoY food parcel numbers and this is only going to increase as the Covid Crisis extends.

If you can share the price of a cuppa tea to help a hungry person today. Please do.

#shareacuppa

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our Baker Hughes JustGiving page.

To challenge ourselves and also support our local community we are setting out on a journey..

The aim collectively as a team, we will walk, run or cycle the equivalent distance from Newcastle upon Tyne to Sao Paulo via Houston and Niteroi, linking our 4 sites, over 16,000 kilometers. 

NCL to Houston - 7566 Km

Houston to Niteroi - 8085 Km

Niteroi to Sao Paulo - 386 Km

Locally we are already supporting the NHS by donating PPE so we wanted to support a worthy local foodbank which is located not far from our Newcastle Site as they need all the support we can give them during this difficult time.

The challenge is open to all and you can log your distance via the survey link here  http://surveys.ge.com/create/500122  add as many times as you like.

Thanks so much for your efforts and support.

Andy Mason

Title: SCA Stoke Fundraiser

Description:
A new year brings a new challenge…

My team and I, plus the wider SOMT team under @Julie Smart at Barclays are going to collectively be virtually walking, running and cycling the distance from Teesside in the UK via the various  Barclays sites we are based at for work in the UK, to Pune in India – almost 6,500 miles in total, this year. 

 

Why are we doing this? 

Two simple reasons:

  • Firstly, at a time when most of us are working from home, having something as a target that helps keep us all fit and healthy is really important for both mental any physical wellbeing.
  • Secondly, and really importantly to all of us, we have selected a number of charities that are aiming to help those in most  financial need through the pandemic with food provisions. These are all local to the sites in which we work - supporting the communities near our places of work is something we are
    all passionate about.

What would we like from you?

Obviously it would be great if you could give a donation of any amount to one of the charities, to support their great work (feel free to pick which ever you want or is closest to you), but if you cant, a simple cheer/like/word of encouragement would be just as appreciated to keep us on the virtual road to Pune (and maybe even motivate us to try the ‘return’ journey)
Title: Craig's Teesside to Pune

Description:
Feeding 100 families for twenty days

£3 feeds one family for three days. Why not skip a coffee and help Amity and Zach to feed a family today? If they hit their target, with your help, 100 families in Lewisham will be able to access food for twenty days.  

Families in Lewisham are struggling to eat more than ever 

In 2013, one in five parents in Lewisham were skipping meals to ensure their children could eat. Almost one in ten children went to bed hungry most nights. Fast forward to 2019, and one in five children were still living in poverty, with Lewisham being the 48th most deprived local authority in the country. The pandemic has only made matters worse. One local foodbank serving 25-30 families before COVID-19 struck says it found itself feeding 5000 families last summer. 

The Great Clean Up

Lewisham is also one of the greenest parts of London, with the much loved Blackheath Common surely being the jewel in the crown of Lewisham's green spaces. However, litter on the common has become a growing problem during the pandemic, with people pushed outdoors by lockdown rules.

Cleaning the Heath to feed Lewisham 

Amity and Zach are two 14-year-olds from the Blackheath area, studying together at Sevenoaks School, who are ready to take on both of these problems, cleaning up the Common to raise money to feed Lewisham's hungry children. Please show them your support.   

Thank you

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Our Foodbank is run by local people for local people – we rely on the community’s support to ensure we can continue to stop people going hungry.

My family gave food at Christmas and I would really like to help out more so I have decided to do a skipping challenge in support of our local Foodbank in Forest Hill. 

I'm going to do 400 skips a day for 5 weeks to try and raise £300.  That is 14,000 skips!!!

Not everyone is as lucky as me and some people don't have much food.  Because of Covid, I think that some children's parents may have lost their jobs so they may not be able to pay for food. 

I would really really appreciate it if you all sponsor me but don't feel you have to. I would like you all to know this is for a good cause and I'm starting today, Monday 8th February. Lots of love from Maude

Description:
This year is STEM's 6th consecutive Spirit of Giving campaign, since 2016 we have raised over 12,300 £/items for food banks around the world and we aim to make 2021 our biggest effort yet!

With a target of 4000 £/items, we will be teaming up with our sister companies Vynamic and Putnam to make a difference this winter by donating to local food banks and fundraising for the Global Food Banking Network (GFN).

Thank you to everyone contributing to the cause!

The importance of Spirit of Giving

We all know the impact that COVID-19 has had on our own lives, but since the pandemic broke out an estimated 2 billion people are facing food insecurity. By donating to local food banks or non-profits, such as GFN you are supporting community-based organisations to ensure that people facing hunger can access a nutritious meal.
Title: Spirit of Giving

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

George the Cat and the Christmas Spirited team at Stourbridge Junction have had their call to help a local charity fundraiser answered by 3 kings of kindness in a festive lighting mission this December to help a local charitable community fundraiser David who had been doubly hit by Covid and medical complications. 

David and his family are really grateful for the help.  It means that they can all could see the happiness of Christmas having begun rather than have them focus on feelings of unwellness. But we know so many families are struggling at this time of year, particularly with rising energy costs among other rising domestic bills and food costs.

'We would like to place on record our grateful thanks to Matthew Alan and Drew, and to the very many followers of George the Cat from all over the world who have been incredibly kind and offered their good wishes. It is clear to us that true kindness is like a bloodline that brings people together - it reduces anxiety, brightens the darkest days and brings communities together to solve problems.

In the spirit of shining a light for others, we would like to take the opportunity to grow this deed for us into something people can share their appreciation for and donate something this Christmas to the Black Country Foodbank so people there can help even more people have an easier time this season.

In the spirit of light this Christmas, please help us to help others, just like we have been helped.
Title: Shine a Christmas Light - donate to Black Country Food Bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.  

I have huge respect for my Muslim colleagues who work hard while fasting during Ramadan.  Ramadan is a time to reflect, pray and get involved in charitable giving donating through donating time and money.  Fasting is very difficult but this will be an opportunity to think about people who don't have easy access to food.

I'm raising money for a cause who tackle feelings of hunger and poverty felt by local people each day. Manchester Central Foodbank who provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Please donate what you can.  Think about what you would have spent on lunch:

  • One day - £3
  • Two days - £6
  • Working week - £15
  • Month - £60

Thank you for your support with our efforts!

Description:
Christmas is a magical time for us at Jam Jar. As a family, we're surrounded by people we love and the magic of it all literally beams out of mini jam jar all the way through December. As a business we get to style some incredible events, and be surrounded by all that sparkles and shimmers. Sadly though, we know that many families on our own doorstep won't have the same feelings about Christmas. The dread of where to find the money for food shouldn't happen to anyone, at any time of year, but especially at christmas. As a mom, a wife and a business, I want to make a little difference to some of the families who need a bit of extra help this year.

I will be donating to the Black Country Food Bank on Tuesday 3rd Decemeber, and anything we raise on this page, I am aiming for £100 which I will match and buy additional donations. You can also leave donations at the studio too.

Please do share! The more of us who make a small donation will make a big difference.

Thanks guys xxx

Title: Keep Cambridge fed during the coronavirus pandemic

Description:
On Monday 11 May starting at 1300 hrs we will attempt a 24hr 417-mile indoor cycling charity challenge in aid of Morecambe Bay Foodbank. We will take our turns to try and make the distance on Zwift! We aim to circumnavigate the Irish Sea.

Stage 1 - Heysham to Liverpool 66.2m    

Stage 2 - Seatruck route from Liverpool – Dublin 136.9m

Stage 3 - Dublin to Warrenpoint 72.4m    

Stage 4 - Seatruck route from Warrenpoint back to Heysham141.5m

We have decided to do this challenge to raise money for the Morecambe Bay Foodbank. 417 miles is a long way and it will be touch and go if we can make it in 24 hrs. The Morecambe Bay Foodbank has always done amazing work but their efforts during the COVID-19 have been incredible.

The Morecambe Bay Foodbank exists to help people in crisis by providing three days' worth of emergency food. They also provide school uniforms to children who need them in the area through our Uniform Project. You help to raise funds to pay for a new van so that they can continue their work. Their old van is getting too small and they need a new one so that they can keep on working to feed and help people in the area.

Thank you for your generosity,

Alistair, Meg, Will & Bess Eagles (Google the dog will be watching!)
Title: The Eagles Family 400 mile 24 hr Zwift Cycle Challenge

Description:
In this run up to Christmas, it should remain at the forefront of our minds the amazing and unfortunately necessary work that Stoke-on-Trent Food Bank do for the community.

2020 has been one hell of a year, and the Covid-19 crisis has only done more to exasperate the need within our communities for this vital
service. It is cold and bleak out there, and countless people are reliant on food banks to prevent hunger. 

Last year’s appeal was wonderful. We broke all expectations, and we have never been prouder of what our small community was able to achieve. Every little donation helps in this campaign, and we recognise that everyone is feeling some difficulty right now. We aren’t out to smash last year’s sum (£1,342 after setting an initial target of £200!), as wonderful as that would be.

We just want to support our community, and do our part, and (as some more talented people have said) leave the world a little bit better than we found it.

Description: During these unusual times I have been wanting to raise some money for the local food bank. Only two months ago we were living comfortably as a family of four with two full time working incomes, now we are relying on benefits and support from our family to get by. This has made me realise just how quickly things can turn and that so many just now don't have the option of any support. Food banks are so important for so many families not just during this pandemic but every single day. I would love to do some door step portraits for families to capture this unique time. If your family is like mine and sporting many lockdown home hair cuts (including the dogs) then lets capture these special memories forever. All I ask in return is for a donation to the South Ayrshire Food Bank.

Description:
WE SMASHED THE TARGET! Thank you so much everybody :) As a reward I will host the replay on my website for a week :) 

http://linuxbrit.co.uk/djpc.html

There are people going hungry in our local community every day, and the issue has been hugely exacerbated by COVID-19. Donating even a small amount could help a family in dire need. Or dig deep and see them through the summer!

I'm hosting a DJ set live on twitch (twitch.tv, it's a free live streaming platform you can watch on your mobile device, laptop or smart tv) on Wednesday July 8th from 19:00-20:30 BST and will ask for donations in return - think of it as your admission ticket. 

I taught myself how to do this the year before last, so I'm only an enthusiastic amateur - I may even embarrass myself! Either way it should be a fun 90 minutes!


We're calling it: Go big and stay home!

So let's turn the volume up, have a virtual house party, let our hair down and maybe even crack open a beer (or your favourite non alcoholic beverage) or two!

Even if you can't make it please think about supporting this important cause.

Joining instructions:

The URL is: https://www.twitch.tv/djtomgilbert 

You might want to create a twitch account if you don't have one, then you can subscribe to notifications when the channel airs. You can watch on phone/ipad/laptop or even cast it to your smart TV if you have one!

If I get disconnected (rural ADSL) I will rejoin within a few minutes so just refresh the twitch page. 

Tom.

“The foodbank was there when we really needed it, it was an absolute lifeline.”

We don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That’s why we provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Title: Caroline's RPH Cake Sale

Description:
This is the JustGiving Page set up in memory of Sharn Iona Hughes.

Sharn was an incredibly kind and generous person, who always put the needs of others before her own. She was a selfless member of the community and a born organiser. She will be greatly missed by her family, friends, her colleagues - past and present, and the organisations in which she was so extensively involved; including Gallt Melyd Church, Gwaenysgor Choir, Trelawnyd Women's Institute and the Dyserth Women's Institute for whom she was pivotal in  coordinating educational, cultural and charitable events.

Most recently, Sharn was involved in the process of organising deliveries of hampers to the local food bank in Prestatyn through the Women's Institute. We, her family and friends, would like to continue her legacy of tireless charitable work, and so we ask for you to make a memorial donation to this fund which will go to the Prestatyn & Meliden Foodbank in Sharn's honour. Your donation will go a long way in helping the most vulnerable people in society at Christmas in a year of such economic uncertainty for so many, with projections estimating a near doubling reliance on food banks between this year and the last.  This is what Sharn would have wanted.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: In memory of Sharn Iona Hughes

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am looking to raise money for West Lothian Food Bank because we cannot leave the most vulnerable people in our community behind, especially at this time of year. 

We have seen all over the news the debate regarding Free School Meals for children, which are thankfully being supported in Scotland. But the issue is wider and deeper. Food bank usage has continued to increase  alarmingly and further support is needed to help this vital lifeline continue to support the people who need it. 

We have a responsibility to the vulnerable people in our community. We have a responsibility to help those who have so very little, even if we ourselves only have a little more. Where I was brought up - no one got left behind. People look out for one another. That's what I am asking for today. 

If you can donate, I would be ever so grateful. No matter how little, everything makes a difference. If you could spare the price of a pint or a coffee that would be magic. If you can't donate, then please share, share, share!

Lets go, WestLo!

TLD xo

Title: Teri-Louise's 5k per day for November

Description:
A year ago, I was the Labour Party's General Election candidate for Dudley South. During my campaign I talked to hundreds of local families, many of whom shared with me how difficult it is to make ends meet. One young mum, on a bitterly cold day, told me she only had 80p left on her electricity meter and another spoke about how much harder it is in school holidays when her kids aren't getting fed at school. 

This was a year ago.

Since then, Coronavirus is pushing more families into poverty.

There are over 2,000 children in receipt of Free School Meals in Dudley South and many thousands more across the Black Country more widely. I would like to raise some funds to help the local food bank support them and their families this half-term and beyond.

Thank you for your support
Title: Lucy's fundraising for the food bank

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As I’ve been in lockdown with two little ones I’ve had more time than ever to reflect on our situation and what lockdown would be like for those less fortunate. I myself have been in that position many years ago and remember how hard it was to ask for help. With the recession  hitting the UK hard and more and more families out of jobs every day, there is going to be an greater need for food banks and good will of people more fortunate to help support those that aren’t. 

I’ve set up this page to raise as much money as possible for our local food bank especially as the need for food will increase as we approach the winter months and people will be forced to have to make the hard choice between spending money on food or heating. 

No baby, child, teenager, young person, adult, or elderly person should have to be making these choices. Our government should be doing more to help, but unfortunately that’s not happening. So we need to take matters into our own hands and help those that need it the most. 

Please give what ever you can, a little goes a long way if everyone can chip in ❤️

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Francesca's Raising money to help fight hunger

Description:
Everyone has their lockdown story. All of us will have had our tough times and down days. But for me its all relative.

When people ask how I am coping through the pandemic, I always say the same thing, "Can't complain, I have it better than many."

More and more people are finding hard to make ends meet, heat the house, feed the family and pay the bills. With winter upon us it is more important than ever that we support incredible local initiatives like Morecambe Bay Foodbank, making a real difference to local families, every single day.

I don't want to make this political (even if it is), or lament that we shouldn't need foodbanks (which we shouldn't), those arguments are for another day. Right now, our neighbours, our friends our families and our colleagues need a little help. If you enjoy the show tonight, please give a couple of quid if you can. Know that it makes a REAL difference to a local family... and don't forget to GIFTAID!

Thanks Andy x

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We are living Below the Breadline for 4 weeks, which means that we only have £1 a day each to spend on food, drink and consumables. Access to healthy, tasty food 24/7 is a privilege that we both often take for granted. 2020 saw record numbers of food bank applications; no one in modern Britain should go hungry. The money we save in doing this challenge over the next 4 weeks will be donated to Community Emergency Foodbank and any other kind donations would be greatly appreciated.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Bodycarewecare are delighted to announce on Sunday the 12th of September 2021 Wander4Wellbeing will take place. These walks are an opportunity for people of all ages to connect with the stunning East Lothian countryside with the overall goal of raising as much money as possible for the East Lothian Foodbank.

The walks will take place on the 12th of September 2021 from 8 am until 5 pm.

There are various walking routes to suit all tastes, ages and experience levels.

For those wanting to stay close to the starting point - you can enjoy a beautiful walk around Amisfield walled garden between 1 pm and 5 pm. Open to all ages.

Or join us for part of the river walk, drive to Hailes Castle and then walk along the river to Amisfield walled Garden. This is just under 5 miles long and a stunning walk. Open to all ages.

For those wishing to experience the full walk, it is a breathtaking 12-mile round trip walk from Amisfield Walled Garden Carpark to Traprain along the river Tyne, passing by Sandy's Mill, Hailes Castle, Hailes Mill and then ascend Traprain Law and back again. This is a scenic yet challenging walk with Traprain Law boasting some of the best views of all of East Lothian, Edinburgh, the Lammermuirs and Fife. This route is for those over 18 only.

We are endeavouring to raise as much money as possible for the East Lothian Foodbank. We understand that this is a true lifeline for others in times of need. Food is vital for not only our physical but our mental wellbeing. A simple act of walking can help us help others, whilst improving our own mental, physical and social wellbeing. 

The event is free to all ages, however, any donations will be gratefully received by the East Lothian Foodbank. 

The full and part walking routes will start at 8 am, please register for an earlier time slot if you believe you will need more time to complete your chosen route. To limit the number of participants at one stage of the route at any one time, the walk start times are staggered.

We are thrilled that Amisfield Walled Garden will be open to participants and their friends and family from 1-5 pm at the end of their chosen route to celebrate their achievement. There will be tea and coffee available in the garden as well as plants available on the day. This is a zero-waste event. So please bring your own cup for refreshments and picnic blankets. 

This is a wonderful opportunity to celebrate everything great about our community. We walk, donate, create zero waste, care for our environment and give to those in their time of need. Humans need sustenance to survive and with over 18,000 kgs of food being distributed last year, this could be your opportunity to give a little.

The full 12 Mile route is only open to those over 18 years of age, the part route and Amisfield Walled Garden are open to all ages and levels of fitness. 

We have limited spaces for participation in the walk so quick sign up on the Eventbrite page is recommended, however, it would be lovely to see lots of supporters back in the garden. 

As it is a zero-waste event there are no medals or tee shirts, you can, however, buy a Wander4Wellbeing hoodie following the completion of the event for £40 which must be ordered and paid for in advance if you wish. 

All participants will undertake their own training prior to this event and on the day participate at their own risk and liability.

Thank you in advance for your interest, donations and ultimately attendance in any form. We look forward to meeting you on the 12th of September 2021.  

Sign up via: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/wander4wellbeing-tickets-164617313817

Follow us @Wander4Wellbeing_eastlothian on Instagram

Description:
In the past 10 years, food bank usage has gone from 25,000 people in 2010 to 2.5 million in 2021. This is not sustainable for our society, especially for a country that is one of the richest in the world.


For this reason, I'm raising money to help the families who have been struck the hardest by the coronavirus and can no longer afford to feed their families. Food bank are the last barrier to complete poverty, they need our help.

For this reason, I'll be running a half marathon on the 7th August to raise money fro Manchester Central Food Bank. Any donations would be a huge huge help!

Zak x

Description:
During June the Barclays private cloud team us getting together (virtually of course) to help a local foodbank, the Trussell trust – Manchester branch. They are experiencing a large increase in demand for their services combined with a fall in donations due to covid 19.  Although we are all working from home for the foreseeable future and can’t get together to do the usual cake sales, fun runs and other fundraising events we are all coming together as a team to do a virtuall commute and make a difference.

How do I get involved I hear you say!!! Missing your commute???? I thought so!!!!

  • ·       We have this team justgiving page - To gather donations and sponsorship from the team, maybe donate some of the money saved from this weeks commuting or money saved from cancelled sporting events.  Even better Barclays will double anything we raise!
  • Download strava, search for and join the club "private cloud team" . And use strava to log all our collective activities.
  • We will add up all of our efforts to see which is the furthest Barclays office we can commute!

I’ve had my beard for 5 years now, it’s the source of my powers. I love it, Lindsey likes it, the kids are indifferent. My family hate it.

Description:
Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/2937274356352920/

Lancaster University Running & Athletics club invites you to participate in our ‘Run of the Roses’ charity event. Fundraising for the Morecambe Bay Foodbank, we want Lancaster University’s clubs and societies to try and collectively cover the 170 miles ‘Way of the Roses’ by completing activities between Wednesday 20th - Sunday 31st. This could be through running, walking, stair climbing, lunging or whatever exercise you fancy, and recording the distance you travel. We want clubs, societies and individuals to try and collectively run 170miles, with members then sharing their individual distances to add to their group’s total. Don’t forget to tag your club in your donation comment! 

We want to see how much money we can raise for such a vital cause, and of course how many laps of the ‘Way of the Roses’ that Lancaster University can achieve! There will be prizes for the society that raises the most money and completes the most distance! Interested? For more information, please head over to our FB event page!

Description:
Our team are walking 30 miles to mark our 30 years in business and raise funds for North Cotswold Food Bank

We don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That is why we are supporting North Cotswold Foodbank who provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis. They are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

On Wednesday 15th September, the team will be walking 30 miles in tranches, starting at 7am:

  • Shipston to Adlestrop
  • Adlestop to Bourton on the Water
  • Bourton-on-the-Water to Chedworth Roman Villa

The route is a mixture of footpaths and lanes, and takes in delights such as Todenham Farm Shop, Daylesford Farm Shop, pubs at Little Compton, Bledington and Northleach, and picnic spots in Bourton-on-the-Water and Farmington, not that we will have a great deal of time to enjoy them...

Partner, Tom Hayman-Joyce says: “The Hayman-Joyce team wanted to mark this special occasion with something meaningful and supporting local charities is important to us - so we married the two together. 30 years in business is a wonderful milestone and we wanted to make a positive contribution to the Cotswolds community whilst marking the occasion.”

They provide emergency 3-days food provisions and support to those in crisis. So far, Glasgow NE Foodbanks have been able to successfully provide over 53,000 meals to local people. Title: David Webster's Birthday

Description:
We sadly lost our friend Evan to suicide last year.

Evan was a startlingly beautiful man. A friend to everyone, a bright spark with strong convictions about what we're here to do. His death was one of the most destabilising shocks we've ever endured.

Four of us (Clem, Francis, Jonny & Pete) have decided to hike the West Highland Way in April this year (a notoriously wet patch in the Highland calendar) in his memory. We will be partially wild camping: this was Evan's style.

Evan was committed to social justice, and through his PhD demonstrated how benefit sanctions are harmful for the mental health of claimants. In line with his principles and work we've decided to raise money for a food bank nearby where Evan lived.

Thank you all for your support. See you on the West Highland Way!

We smashed our first four targets, so we've upped it again to 2000!

If you crave detail, read on! The following sections reflect Clem's opinions and should not suggest big headedness on the part of anyone else.

The Task

This is a near impossible task.

We are covering 154km through rain, sleet and possibly snow; ice cold temperatures and intemperate natives. 

We will need to climb a staggering 10,351ft of ascent and descent.

The highest point is called Aonach Eagach ('Devil's Staircase') and if that doesn't chill you to the bone, you haven't googled it yet.

But the TEAM are up to the task!

The Team

  • Pete - The great caregiver of Partick - this man can walk. He can regularly be found putting in 14hr shifts hiking around West Glasgow, brightening the days of the old and the sick. (Yes, fourteen hour shifts)
  • Francis - The pathfinder, the handsome one; and the honeyed tones of his Scottish accent give the group some much needed authenticity.
  • Jonny - Last year this man walked so hard that his feet began to bleed. In the E17 postcode, he's known as 'The Walthamstow Wolf'. He and I will be roughing it on a couple of nights.
  • Clem - Yours truly. My only ticket into the group is that I knew Evan so well (plus I bought some new boots).
  • (In Spirit Form) Evan - I will hear his weird laugh frequently, and I know he'll be with us.

It's hard to say what I miss about him most. If you'd like to experience his unique flavour, please watch this video, and take a look at some of the photos.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CAfVFezKyD7Cy4i47dNc85cPzTli1MUD/view?usp=sharing

Title: SMF December Fundraising

Description:
All donations made will be put towards helping families in desperate need.

Glasgow unfortunately has one of the highest rates of poverty in the UK and thousands of children and families are struggling to even get a meal a day.

If you’d prefer to donate food/items you can visit https://glasgowsw.foodbank.org.uk/give-help/donate-food/ There will be a list to show what the food bank is in urgent need of. 

If you want to donate to a different food bank closer to you then you can check where your local food bank is by just clicking on the link below and typing in your postcode. 

https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/

Cheers
Title: Ross's Food Bank Collection

Description:
I am challenging myself this December in order to raise money for a local Food bank based in South West Glasgow. The use of food banks in Scotland are at an all time high. It is estimated that over 6000 three day emergency food supplies was given to people in crisis last year. The use of food banks has increased by 17% in the last year, and it is estimated that 1 in 5 people live below the poverty line. 

If you are able to donate, you will be helping many local families in need of basic supplies which most of us take for granted! 

Thank you for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)
Title: Heather's 5/10k a day

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Living in Bramhall or surrounding areas, you will no doubt be aware of the amazing work that Chelwood Foodbank does to help so many families in Stockport.

Coronavirus has hit the service hard, not least because:
- Demand for the service has increased
- Food supply is more limited
- A significant number of the foodbank's volunteers fall into the higher risk brackets

Helping Hands Bramhall is completely committed to helping all vulnerable people in our area through this time. And with that, comes our plea to you.  Can you spare £1-2 to help Chelwood continue to keep it's doors open and feed one of the absolutely most vulnerable pockets of society?

Title: 33000 Push ups for November

Description:
This fundraising page is something we as a family have wanted to do for quite some time. With the Covid pandemic hitting the world in 2020 it has caused us to reflect even more so on how many things we are so very blessed to receive at Christmas time, but perhaps don't "need". We are struck when we look around us at so many other people who are in much more need than us. 

Therefore, rather than receiving an overwhelming amount of lovely gifts at Christmas this year, we would instead like to invite our friends and family to donate to Leeds South & East Foodbank who are partnered with The Trussell Trust to further their works in providing meals to local people who are in crisis. Supporting a local Foodbank is something we feel strongly and passionately about as we believe this will make a much bigger difference in not just ours but other people's lives and in general, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK. 

If you could kindly donate any amount of money you might have spent on us this Christmas to our chosen charity instead, this will go a long way and mean the world to us this Christmas time. We ourselves as a family will too be contributing and would like to thank you for taking the time to read this and help out where you can. If you would like to learn more about the charity, you can click on their icon above which will take you to their page.

Last but not least, Merry Christmas from the Kwoks.

* Make a donation on our JustGiving page, to enable us to purchase hamper items.

Give us a call or private message us on Facebook for more details. This Christmas let's be #MeccaTogether and support our local community.

Title: Let's Spread Some Cheer

Description:
Charitable giving is an important part of who we are at Enable. Last year we managed to raise an amazing £3,100 for the Stratford-upon-Avon Foodbank, and we have decided to support them again this year as part of our 2021 "Cause of the Year".

This year our cause is homelessness and rough-sleeping, and we're pleased to support the Foodbank in this as they look to move their HQ to the upcoming Fred Winter Center in Stratford-upon-Avon. (Read more here https://stratforduponavon.foodbank.org.uk/2019/09/05/stratford-foodbank-reveals-plans-for-new-home/). 

This year as a company we're collectively running 5,270 miles (the distance between Stratford-upon-Avon to San Francisco) and you can pledge to sponsor us per mile by emailing charity@enable.com.

We have identified other charities we're supporting this year, and you can find their fundraising pages here:

https://uk.virginmoneygiving.com/EnableCauseOfTheYear2021

https://www.gofundme.com/f/enables-cause-of-the-year-2021

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Due to lockdown restrictions I won't be able to play football until at least 2nd December, so I decided that I was going to keep active by going out running throughout the week.

I thought I would set myself a challenge of running 100k during the 4 week lockdown. Then I thought why not do this for a good cause and raise money for charity.

I have decided to try and raise money for The South and East Leeds Foodbank. Last year they provided 12,550 three day emergency food supplies to people in the local community.

1 in 5 of the UK population lives below the poverty line.

Lots of families are struggling in these difficult times so I'm hoping by raising a little bit of money, it will help those in need.
